title: Remodeling/Insurance Estimator
description:
As a Remodeling/Insurance Estimator at Your Home Expert, you will play a pivotal role in assessing, estimating, and managing remodeling and insurance-related projects. You will collaborate closely with clients, insurance adjusters, subcontractors, and internal teams to ensure accurate and competitive estimates that align with project objectives and industry standards. This position requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and effective communication to deliver exceptional customer service and drive project success. ResponsibilitiesEstimation and Assessment:Conduct thorough onsite assessments of residential to determine scope of remodeling or insurance-related work.Utilize industry-standard estimating software and tools to prepare detailed cost estimates, including materials, labor, equipment, and overhead expenses.Collaborate with clients, insurance adjusters, and office management to understand project requirements and expectations.
Client Relationship Management:Serve as the initial primary point of contact for clients throughout the estimation and project execution phases.Communicate effectively with clients to address inquiries, provide updates, and resolve issues promptly and professionally.Foster positive relationships with clients through exceptional service, transparency, and responsiveness.
Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate records of project documentation, including estimates, contracts, change orders, and correspondence.Generate regular progress reports and updates for clients, internal stakeholders, and insurance companies as necessary.

QualificationsMust be proficient in Xactimate and Symbility.Proven experience in estimating and project management within the construction or remodeling industry.Extensive knowledge in construction methods, materials, water damages, exterior, roofing and mitigation.Extensive knowledge of sketching, negotiating supplements, private estimation.Negotiate and finalize supplements with insurance carrier.Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.Ability to multitask, prioritize workload, and work effectively under pressure.Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and quality.Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.Must be available for FULL TIME schedule.
Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field preferred.Certification or licensure in construction estimating or project management.Experience working with insurance companies and handling insurance-related claims.Familiarity with residential and commercial remodeling processes and best practices.

title: Manager, Conference Operations
description:
National Association of Manufacturers
Position Description
Job Title: Manager, Conference OperationsDivision: Finance and AdministrationDepartment: Conference and Office OperationsReports To: Senior Director, Conference OperationsFLSA Status/Level: Exempt/ProfessionalLocation: DC Headquarters

Position Overview:
The National Association of Manufacturers (NAM) is seeking a Manager, Conference Operations. This person is a key member of the Conferences Operations team. The position includes managing registration for assigned conferences and events, in addition to the day-to-day operations of the remote meetings platform, supporting program stake holders and the Conference Operations team as directed. This position will also have its own portfolio of conferences and events as assigned by the Director, Conferences Operations. They will be highly organized, adept at working in a fast-paced environment, have excellent communication and listening skills, and enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment. 
Join the NAM and Make an Impact in the Following Ways: 
 External Meeting Services (90%)This position is responsible for registration management for all assigned conferences and events, including onsite registration management.Create and manage assigned CVENT meeting websites.Full logistical management for assigned conferences, and plant facility tours.Management of on-site event logistics for assigned conferences and events.Manage Mobile App for assigned conferences and events.Ensure high-quality event experiences for speakers and attendees by scheduling planning meetings, doing tech preparation with speakers, and managing the run-of-show in close coordination with program owners.Manage site selection including venue research and contracting for assigned conferences and events.Process registration requests/changes for events.Manage the internal virtual webinar calendar and ensure no cross-over or overlap.Plan, produce, and manage assigned virtual events.Serve as point person on the day of webinars to coordinate and support all internal and external participants.Work with program owners to coordinate logistics, communication, and registration content for all virtual events.Keep abreast of industry trends and technology and make recommendations for integrating new technologies that will lead to greater efficiency and delivery of services.Manage shipment of materials to and from events.Some before and after office hours, weekends, and travel may be required (less than 25%)Complete post-event tasks including reconciliation of expenses, evaluation of vendor services and products, and preparing written evaluations and recommendations.Research and contract event vendors as needed. 

Internal Conference Operations (10%)Backup support for conferences and events held at the NAM Conference Center.Management of vendors and temp staff as needed.

The above list of responsibilities is representative of the position and is not intended to limit or preclude other responsibilities and tasks that may be associated with or added to the position.
 Supervisory Responsibilities:No direct reportsPosition may provide direction and guidance to temp or other staff assisting with Conference Operations.
We are looking for Team Players who meet the Following Criteria:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.CVENT Experience is RequiredMinimum of 2-3 years of meeting management/planning experience.Proficient in Webinar Platforms, Zoom, and GoToMeetings.Proficient in MS Office including Word, Outlook, and Excel.Highly collaborative, with demonstrated success working across teams.Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively with staff at all levels.Ability to manage multiple projects with competing and changing priorities and deadlines.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, quality and goal-driven work environment.Willingness to occasionally work nights and/or weekendsMust be willing to travel to assigned events if needed.Ability to lift up to 30 lbs.Position requires a cheerful and people-oriented disposition, with the ability to interact with various levels of people in a courteous, friendly, and helpful manner.Innovative and focused on solutions and problem-solving.Position requires a high degree of reliability and punctuality.Must be able to multi-task providing a high level of customer service.Must be flexible and able to handle changing priorities and additional, unplanned tasks.Strong team player.Self-starter mentality and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.A demonstrated commitment to excellence.Ability to execute and exhibit good judgment.An optimistic outlook and a flexible, innovative nature.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
Equal Opportunity Employer
The National Association of Manufacturers is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We welcome and celebrate everyone’s uniqueness here at the NAM. We provide equal opportunities to individuals regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
We also consider qualified applicants with conviction histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. At the NAM, we believe in Second Chances! The NAM is committed to offering equal employment opportunities to ALL. We only require that you have the qualifications, talent and passion to be successful in your role.
The NAM is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at humanresources@nam.org.
 The National Association of Manufacturers (NAM) is the largest manufacturing association in the United States and one of the nation’s most influential advocates for manufacturing. By joining the NAM, you become part of a spirited and dynamic team that is driven to succeed. We recognize and reward our staff with competitive pay and annual performance-based bonus programs. We offer an outstanding benefits package that includes health, dental, and vision insurance, life, short-term and long-term disability, flexible spending accounts, SmarTrip, and a 401(k) Salary Deferral plan with employer match and contributions, vacation and sick leave, complimentary on-site gym access and healthy snacks in the break room. Become part of a fast-paced team passionate about keeping the United States the world leader in manufacturing.
Get involved. Make an impact. Join the NAM team. Learn more at www.nam.org/careers

title: Associate Compliance Officer and Director of International Affairs Compliance
description:
One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest continuous site of higher education in Florida. FSU is a community steeped in tradition that fosters research, encourages creativity, and embraces diversity. At FSU, there’s the excitement of being part of a vibrant academic and professional community, surrounded by people whose ideas are shaping tomorrow’s news!
The Associate Compliance Officer and Director of International Affairs Compliance is situated in the FSU Office of Compliance and Ethics and reports to the Chief Compliance and Ethics Officer.
Responsibilities
The Director reports to the Chief Compliance and Ethics Officer. The Director serves as a liaison to the Office of Research in matters related to foreign influence in research and other activities involving cross-border transactions. Consults and collaborates with the Director of the Office of Research Compliance Programs as needed to provide strategic support to the Office of Research’s export control compliance, research security and integrity, and classified research programs as part of the University’s overall compliance scheme. Serves as a central point of contact for compliance associated with contracts, grants, agreements, and gifts involving foreign participants or sources, including associated approval processes and state and federal reporting requirements under ch. 288, F.S.
The Director is responsible for FSU’s foreign researcher screening programs in compliance with s. 1010.35, F.S., and the foreign travel program pursuant to s. 1010.36, F.S. Conducts screenings and coordinates the office’s activities in these areas as a team lead.  In support of the university’s academic mission, the Director provides compliance oversight and support for FSU’s programs for visiting scholars and assists with vetting non-student visa applications, in collaboration with the Office of Research Compliance Programs and Office of General Counsel. The Director also provides strategic compliance oversight and support for all international academic programs and activities, including study abroad programs and operation of the University’s overseas study centers, and serves as the main compliance liaison for the Office of International Programs. 
In addition to serving as a specialist in the areas listed above, the Director is expected to serve as a higher education compliance generalist, providing support as needed in all areas of higher education compliance. This includes coordinating or assisting in the development and implementation of training programs, serving as a communications point-person for stakeholders in a complex compliance environment, and other projects as assigned.
Required Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of six years of experience with three years specifically in compliance, legal affairs, or a related fields. (Note: Higher education can substitute for experience at the equivalent rate.)
Have, or applied for, U.S. Government Security Clearance at the Secret level within two months of appointment [Need citizenship, permanent resident alien, lawful permanent resident, or protected individual status to get a security clearance].
Preferred Qualifications
Juris Doctor degree strongly preferred.Experience in a compliance or legal role at an institution of higher education.Experience in sponsored research agreement review, grant application writing or review, or negotiation of research contracts.Experience with databases and electronic systems required for regulatory implementation, such as Visual ComplianceTM.Experience with Huron’s COI and/or Research modules.Knowledge and experience working with federal security policies and procedures.Experience implementing policies related to export control regulations (e.g., ITAR, EAR, OFAC).Certified Compliance and Ethics Professional designation.Ability to work with diverse groups/populations.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.High degree of professionalism and ability to deal discreetly with sensitive information.Unimpeachable personal and professional integrity.Strong listening, writing, and presentation skills.Proficiency with Microsoft Office and the use of web-based applications.
How to Apply:
Visit https://jobs.fsu.edu/ and search Job ID 57397
FSU is an Equal Opportunity/Access/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer.

title: Research Associate (Scientific Communications)
description:
Job title: Research Associate (Scientific Communications)
Job statement: The Research Associate (Scientific Communications) works with the Head of Scientific and Medical Affairs, as well as staff from other departments, to efficiently communicate technical plans and progress to internal and external stakeholders by writing concise scientific reports, protocols, articles, regulatory submissions, presentations, and other content as needed in the field of innovative medical diagnostics development. If you are passionate about technical writing, scientific communication, and contributing to the development of disruptive medical diagnostics, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Location: On-site in Aptitude’s Santa Barbara/Goleta facility.
About usAptitude Medical Systems is a startup deep-tech healthcare company. Our mission is democratizing diagnostics by empowering individuals to access their health and diagnostic information anytime, anywhere. Aptitude created a simple, accurate, and easy-to-use diagnostic platform that fits in the palm of the hand and allows anyone to run a complex lab-quality PCR test in their own hands in minutes. Aptitude’s lead product, Metrix™ COVID-19 Test, is the first FDA-authorized molecular diagnostic test to work with saliva or swab samples for at-home and over-the-counter use without physician supervision, and we have a product pipeline that includes tests for a wide range of health and wellness conditions. Imagine being able to consult your doctor, run the diagnostic tests you need, and get a prescription without having to leave your home. That's the future we're building. Come join us!
About the roleIn this position, you will be working closely with a cross-functional team of mission-driven scientists and engineers to drive the invention and development of novel diagnostic products. You will play a crucial role in synthesizing complex research findings into clear and concise reports, articles, and other written materials in the context of medical diagnostics. This role will directly report to the Head of Scientific and Medical Affairs.
If you are passionate about technical writing, scientific communication, and contributing to the development of disruptive medical diagnostics, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
In this role, you willWork collaboratively with researchers, scientists, and other team members to understand complex technical concepts and translate them into accessible written content.Review and edit written materials related to medical diagnostics for accuracy, clarity, and consistency, ensuring that content meets organizational standards and objectives.Research, write and edit reports, summaries, investigators’ brochures, package inserts, protocols, and other documents that may be submitted for publication and/or presentation.Work independently and with our team to develop and manage timelines for contract deliverables.
ResponsibilitiesAnalyze and interpret research data generated by R&D to understand implications of findings and effectively communicate conclusions and insights to both internal and external parties through written reports and presentations for diverse audiences.Prepare reports, summary documents, grants, investigator's brochures, package inserts, protocols and protocol amendments, and other documents that may be submitted for publication and/or presentation.Attend regular project meetings to understand key goals and narratives.Become intimately familiar with and manage timelines of contractual requirements and deliverables associated with research projects.Provide support to researchers in the preparation of grant proposals, project summaries, and other written materials related to medical diagnostic assay development.Perform other duties as assigned.
QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor's degree in a relevant scientific field (chemistry, biology, biomedical engineering, etc.). Those with professional experience in a relevant field and/or an advanced degree or progress towards an advanced degree are strongly encouraged to apply.Strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with meticulous attention to detail.Experience in scientific research and technical writing, preferably in the context of medical diagnostics or assay development.Experience in effectively communicating complex data and ideas to audiences with diverse levels of experience.Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools/software, particularly as applied to medical diagnostic data.Familiarity with scientific research methodologies, particularly in the context of medical diagnostic assay development.Outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to work within a team.Enthusiasm, curiosity and a willingness to ask questions and learn.The ability to think critically and write clearly and concisely.The ability to establish rapport with all functional leaders, experts, and colleagues.Familiarity with current electronic authoring, document management and electronic regulatory submissions.
BenefitsCompetitive compensation.Growth opportunities inherent to a fast-growing startup.401K Plan with company matching.Medical insurance, including medical, dental, and vision coverage.Flexible paid time off.Immigration support.
Aptitude Medical Systems is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local law.

Healthcare-professional level CPR certificationOhio Licensure (Dialysis Tech Certifcation)

dialysis access and inserts needed and initiates dialysis according to unit protocol and patient prescription• Measures, calculates and adjusts blood flow rates according to established protocols and prescription• Administers anticoagulant according to unit protocols and prescription• Changes fluid removal rate and patient position and administers Normal Saline as directed by RN, ALP order or unit protocol• Monitors vital signs (temperature, pulse, etc.) and patient condition then documents observations appropriately• Documents patient treatment parameters and communicates patient’s conditions and issues to RNs• Monitors patients and equipment, responds to alarms and readjusts treatment parameters as defined by established protocols and individual patient requirements• Responds appropriately to dialysis related emergencies such as hypotensive episodes, needle displacement or infiltration, clotting episodes, blood leaks, air eboli, etc., and initiates CPR in the event of a cardiac or respiratory arrest• Discontinues dialysis and establishes hemostasis following unit protocol and inspects, cleans, and dresses access according to unit protocol• Obtains and records post dialysis vital signs, including weight and temperature• Verifies absence of residual sterilants;• Takes fluid samples or other specimens for testing and prepares them for shipping• Discards dialysis supplies and sanitises the equipment according to the manufacturer and unit protocols• Communicates emotional, medical, psycho-social, and nutritional concerns to the RN or ALP when needed• Under the direction of a registered nurse, monitors and documents the status of, and instructs patient in case of, vascular accesses, etc.• Reinforces treatment care with the patient• Ensures patient has adequate patient care supplies and monitors inventories• Assists nursing staff in administering basic treatments (e.g., hemodialysis therapy, etc.)• Maintains professional conduct, good communication skills and confidentiality in the care of the patients and participates in the multidisciplinary process• Reviews lab work and physician orders• Performs basic clinical procedures (e.g., changing bandages)• Readies the dialysis equipment before treatment and cares for the equipment after treatment• Tests monitors and machine functions, including alarms, conductivity and temperature;• Sets monitors and alarms according to unit and manufacturer protocols• Completes flow sheets (via EMR) in order to verify patient billing• Complies with agency policies and procedures in accordance with state and federal regulations for patient care and services (CMS, HIPAA, OSHA, and other governing agencies)• Participates in quality assurance and cost containment programs• Participates in individual and group projects as directed by management• Other duties, as assigned.

title: Senior Lawyer
description:
Senior Lawyer
Nova Ukraine, a US-based non-profit organization dedicated to supporting Ukraine, is seeking a highly motivated and skilled professional for the Senior Lawyer position. 
The ideal candidate will have hands-on working experience with non-profit organizations on tax matters, as well as advising non-profit boards of directors regarding ongoing compliance with both federal and state laws. Additionally, the candidate should be able to occasionally provide educational presentations on nonprofit compliance and the legal and ethical responsibilities of board members and the organization as a whole.
The main purpose of this position is to provide legal expertise and guidance to ensure the organization's compliance with relevant laws and regulations, as well as to support the organization's mission of supporting Ukraine through legal advocacy and representation.
Among other tasks are: 
negotiating and drafting international grant agreements, both as a grantee and a grantor; drafting policies and guidelines; drafting corporate documentation; legal assistance in audit preparation;consulting employees, contractors and volunteers of the organization;consulting grantees as to compliance requirements and grant agreements provisions;coordinating legal work with international law firms and advisers regarding projects outside of the U.S.;advising and coordinating legal counsel and attorneys in the Ukrainian office with regard to the U.S. legal requirements and the organization's policies; negotiating with international partners and the state authorities of Ukraine and drafting respective legal documents. 
Required skills:Licensed in California; 5+ years of corporate law and/or non-profit law in a law firm or as in-house counsel; Ukrainian language is preferred. 
We offer:
Flexible work schedule (Monday-Friday) with the ability to work remotely.Official employment.Opportunity for personal and professional growth.
Join the Nova Ukraine team and help us build the future together. Please send your CV with a cover letter and expected salary to julia.gerzanich@novaukraine.org

title: Battery R&D Scientist
description:
NextGen Battery Technologies, LLC is developing a high-voltage, high energy density, solid-state lithium battery architecture that outperforms current industry standards of safety and energy density.
Our vision is to be an innovative and productive developer of high-value, market-changing battery materials and systems, while creating for its colleagues an atmosphere of enthusiasm, creativity, and teamwork.
Our mission is to develop and market directly or in consort with others, high performance battery materials targeting high value markets, along with integrating our materials into cells and battery systems.
We have successfully leveraged our resources since initiation through collaboration with other entities with whom we share a community of interest, in effect partnering to address performance goals or “pain areas” vital to their market and economic interests.
We are seeking a talented technical leader to play an important role in the continued execution of our technology development strategy.
NextGen Battery Technologies offers a competitive salary and benefits package for this position.
To learn more about us please visit our Website:https://nextgbtech.com
Responsibilities:This self-starting individual will have a good understanding of electrochemistry and the desire to use it in an R&D context.
The role will include coordination with internal technical development staff and external partners to further refine and advance the company's cathode and electrolyte, along with translating these materials to solutions to address customer needs.
As a technical representative of the company, the Battery R&D Scientist will also develop relationships with potential technical partners and collaborators, including government agency program managers and industry technical staff, regarding new programs and potential commercial relationships.
This objective may be supplemented by attendance at industry conferences, presenting and/or publishing papers, and identification of opportunities and preparation of proposals for government funding programs. 
Qualifications:Ph.D. or equivalent in battery-related Chemistry, Materials Science, Engineering, or a similarly relevant field.
Experience in electrochemistry development and evaluation.
Strong background in design, fabrication and testing of lithium or lithium-ion cells in a variety of formats (coin, pouch, prismatic, cylindrical).
Demonstrated experience with proposal/grant preparation and report writing.Experience in project coordination and planning.
Strong comfort level working in a collaborative team environment.
Creative, self-driven thinker with an insatiable curiosity, a history of problem solving, and an ability to wear many hats.
Proficiency in MS Office and mainstream business software.

title: Sales Director
description:
Job Description: Director of Sales



Company Overview:
We are a reputable wholesale company specializing in Dress Up Costumes and additionally we have several Toy Brands. With an established presence in the market, we supply high-quality products to a diverse range of customers. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Director of Sales to lead our sales and achieve our ambitious sales targets.


Position Overview:
As the Director of Sales, you will be responsible for developing and executing sales strategies to maximize revenue and market share. Reporting directly to the CEO, you will play a critical role in driving the company's sales performance and establishing long-term customer relationships.


Responsibilities:
Sales Strategy Development: Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy to achieve company sales goals, increase market penetration, and identify new business opportunities. Continuously evaluate and adapt the sales strategy to stay ahead of market trends.Sales Performance Tracking: Monitor sales metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess sales performance, identify areas for improvement, and take corrective actions as needed. Prepare regular reports and presentations on sales results and forecasts for senior management.Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers and strategic partners. Collaborate with the marketing team to develop targeted sales campaigns, promotions, and customer retention strategies. Ensure exceptional customer service and satisfaction at all times.Market Analysis and Competitor Intelligence: Stay abreast of industry trends, market conditions, and competitive activities. Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, preferences, and emerging opportunities. Utilize insights to develop sales strategies and gain a competitive edge.Sales Budgeting and Forecasting: Collaborate with the finance team to develop the sales budget and revenue forecasts. Monitor sales expenses and ensure efficient allocation of resources to achieve sales targets while maintaining profitability.Trade Show Management: Plan, coordinate, and oversee the company's participation in trade shows and industry events. Develop strategies to maximize the company's presence and visibility at trade shows, including booth design, promotional materials, and staffing. Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to ensure alignment with overall sales objectives. Evaluate the success of trade show participation and make recommendations for improvements based on performance metrics and feedback.Collaboration and Cross-functional Alignment: Collaborate closely with other departments such as marketing, operations, and finance to align sales initiatives with overall company objectives. Foster a collaborative and cohesive working environment to drive synergy across departments.


Requirements:
Proven Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales management, preferably in a wholesale or B2B environment. Demonstrated success in achieving and exceeding sales targets.Leadership Skills: Strong leadership qualities with a track record of building and managing successful sales teams. Ability to inspire, motivate, and guide a diverse group of individuals towards a common goal.Strategic Thinking: Exceptional strategic and analytical thinking abilities. Proven experience in developing and implementing effective sales strategies to drive revenue growth.Industry Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of the costume and toy industry and understanding of market dynamics. Familiarity with wholesale operations and distribution channels is highly desirable.Customer Focus: A customer-centric mindset with a strong commitment to providing exceptional service and building long-term customer relationships. Proven ability to identify customer needs and develop tailored sales approaches.Communication and Presentation Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to articulate complex ideas and concepts clearly and effectively. Strong presentation skills for delivering sales forecasts and reports to senior management.Results-driven: A self-motivated and proactive individual with a strong sense of accountability. Demonstrated ability to drive results, meet deadlines, and handle multiple priorities simultaneously.Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor's degree in business administration, sales, marketing, or a related field is preferred

title: Pediatric Occupational Therapist
description:
**Clinic Overview:**Join our dynamic team at Busy Body Pediatric Therapy , a small but thriving pediatric clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive occupational therapy services to children in our community. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence, individualized care, and fostering a supportive environment for both our team members and the families we serve. In addition to our clinic-based services, we also offer early intervention programs in homes and daycares, ensuring that children receive the care they need in familiar environments.
**Position Summary:**We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Pediatric Occupational Therapist to join our team on a part-time basis with the ability to grow to a full-time position. The ideal candidate will have experience working with children of all ages and abilities, with a focus on providing evidence-based interventions to promote optimal development and functional independence. This is an hourly (per visit) W-2 position. Our clinic is located in Marietta, near the 75/285. There is also an opportunity to see children 0-3 in homes and dayares as part of Babies Can't Wait. 
**Responsibilities:**- Conduct comprehensive evaluations to assess children's motor skills, sensory processing, and activities of daily living.- Develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each child/family’s unique needs and goals.- Provide direct one-on-one therapy sessions in our clinic setting.- The opportunity to deliver early intervention services (Cobb and Douglas County Babies Can’t Wait) in homes and daycares, collaborating closely with families and caregivers.- Monitor progress, adjust treatment plans as needed, and communicate effectively with parents, caregivers, and other healthcare professionals.- Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of evaluations, treatment sessions, and progress reports.**Qualifications:**- Master's degree (or higher) in Occupational Therapy from an accredited program.- Current state license or eligibility for licensure as an Occupational Therapist.- Must have a Medicaid Number already.- Experience working with pediatric populations.- Strong understanding of child development, sensory processing, and developmental disorders.- Commitment to continuing education and staying current with best practices in pediatric occupational therapy.- Pass a background check.
**Benefits:**- Flexible Schedule- Direct Deposit- Supportive work environment with a collaborative team approach.- Meaningful work helping children reach their full potential and empowering families to support their child's development.- Beautiful clinic space located in a quaint walkable office park.
**Compensation**- $50-$60 per hour- Pay differential for evaluations- Special rate for documentation/administration time
**How to Apply:**If you are enthusiastic about making a difference in the lives of children and families, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and cover letter to info at busybodytherapy dot com with the subject line "Pediatric OT Position Application." In your cover letter, please tell us at least 2 of your favorite interventions/activities to use with clients. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

description:

Qualifications/Experience: Must have 2-3 years of work experience in PR Must be extremely organized, detail-oriented, and have the ability to adhere to tight deadlines Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as interpersonal skills, and the ability to take initiative and work independently Must have excellent problem-solving skills Must have strong project management skills Must be proactive with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a collaborative yet fast-paced environment; understanding of how to prioritize duties, meet deadlines, communicate progress and deliverables Must have experience with media relations and media coverage amplification Must be a team player, with the ability to anticipate needs of the team Skilled in PR tools such as Meltwater, Cision and Muck Rack, or ability to learn quickly

title: Product Validation Engineer (EVT/DVT)
description:
About Anello Photonics:ANELLO Photonics http://www.anellophotonics.com is a leading-edge technology company based in Santa Clara, CA. The company has developed integrated photonic system-on-chip technology for next generation navigation. ANELLO's SIPHOG™ gyroscope is based on its patented photonic integrated circuit technology. The result is a product that is higher performance, much smaller size and weight, at a fraction of the cost of traditional gyros used in industrial, aerospace and military applications. It enables reliable and accurate navigation and positioning across many autonomous applications. Anello is currently engaged in commercial trials with various market-leading customers in the Construction, Farming, Trucking, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles, Autonomous Vehicles, and National Security segments. Generous benefits, competitive pay, appreciating equity, and a collaborative culture make Anello the workplace of choice for accomplished and motivated engineers. 
Job Summary:The Product Validation Engineer (EVT, DVT, PVT) will conceive, execute, and interpret design validation and engineering verification testing programs for the lifecycle of Anello’s ingredient and product portfolio. We are looking for someone with the technical ability to deeply understand the architectures, and the leadership to partner with our engineering development teams with identified issues and recommended solutions. As a key member of the team, you will engage across both software and hardware engineering to work on the real-time validation challenges outstanding to the company’s product development efforts.
Responsibilities:Develop validation plans based upon ingredient and product requirements, as informed by relevant industry standardsDesign overall test plans, identifying key performance indicators and required optical and electrical test methodologiesWork with local labs and 3rd party service providers to execute stress and environmental testsAnalyze results in conjunction with failure mode and effects analysis and comprehensive statistical analysisEvaluate design robustness, draw technical conclusions, and make appropriate recommendations to address issues of product conformance to design intent and specificationExtensively document test plans, results, and recommendations for internal and external communication
Requirements:Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Electrical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Physics, or other engineering field5+ years of industry relevant experience in microelectronic / optical product design and validation spanning from component to module level assembliesIn-depth hands-on experience performing bench-level testing and characterization of optical and electronic devices across corner use casesWorking knowledge of statistical process control, statistical analysis, and FMEAKnowledge of ingredient-level and product-level robustness / reliability stress test requirementsTechnical competence in the area of automotive and military systems qualification standardsExpert in problem-solving, diagnosing, troubleshooting, and providing a solutionExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced and innovation-driven environment
Additional Desired Skills:Experience in autonomous navigation applicationsProficiency with scripting and tools development as instrumental for testing and data analysisBackground in Inertial Measurement UnitsBackground in Silicon PhotonicsSelf-motivated to learn new technologies and a passion for embracing technology
For more information: please visit https://anellophotonics.com/careers

title: Service Supervisor
description:

This position will play a critical role in coordinating the deployment of our field service technicians to various job sites, ensuring timely response to client requests, and maintaining efficient communication channels between field personnel and management. Documentation and Reporting:· Maintain accurate records of service requests, dispatch activities, and job status updates.· Generate reports on service performance, response times, and resource utilization.· Assist in the preparation of field invoices.Qualifications· High school diploma or equivalent; associate’s or bachelor’s degree preferred.· Proven experience in dispatching, scheduling, or logistics coordination, preferably in the oil and gas industry.· Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.· Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey information clearly and concisely.· Proficiency in using computer systems and software applications for scheduling, dispatching, and record-keeping.· Knowledge of oilfield operations, equipment, and terminology is desirable.· Ability to remain calm under pressure and make quick, well-informed decisions to address unforeseen challenges or changes in plans.· Flexibility to work non-standard hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as needed.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS· High School Diploma· 3-5 years’ experience within the Oil and gas industry, preferably MPD relatedPREFERED EXPERIENCE & SKILLS· Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive employee information.· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and HRIS systems.· Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact effectively with employees at all levels of the organization.· Highly organized with excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.· Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS· Lift and carry 50 pounds independently while walking on uneven surfaces· Positions self to install equipment, including under desks.· Moves throughout the building to access files or necessary equipment.· Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.· Ability to safely navigate work sites with occasional walking, climbing, standing, stepping, etc. during various weather conditions (day/night, outdoor hot/cold weather) BENEFITSMedical, Dental and Vision Insurance Available401(k) Earned Personal Time Off (PTO)LTD/STDEAP Program

title: Salesperson

title: Regional Sales Manager
description: Encon Safety Products, Inc., located in Houston, Texas, started manufacturing operations in 1964. Located in the heart of the U.S. Gulf Coast petrochemical industry, Encon® developed its emergency and safety products manufacturing business with a focus on solving problems for hazardous-area applications. Since our inception, Encon® has designed and manufactured market-leading personal protective equipment and hazardous-area storage cases for the protection and security of people, plant and equipment. Coined from the words Environmental Controls, Encon Safety Products today operates in two manufacturing locations to serve our customer base worldwide.  This role is responsible for the Midwest Region.Highlighted states are central to the region and are ideal Candidate locations.The Region includes Accounts in: North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Minnesota, Iowa, Missouri, Michigan, Wisconsin, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio and Kentucky. Position Summary:The Regional Sales Manager (RSM), under the direction of the National Sales Manager, is responsible for the development and implementation of a sales strategy, participation in the marketing plan and to achieve budgeted sales volume for Encon Safety Products within their defined geographical regional trade area while maintaining their budgeted sales expense levels set by Encon Safety Products management. PRINCIPLE ACCOUNTABILITIES:Sales and Market Growth:The individual will be responsible to:Achieve sales and any EBIT objectives for assigned products in all existing accounts and designated markets in the territory while staying within set expense objectives for all activity in the assigned territory.Achieve market penetration in accordance with goals.Maintain and develop distributor relationships to help achieve sales goals determined and defined by Encon Sales and General Management.Complete any Management by Objective (MBO) goals that will be determined by Encon Sales Management from time to time.Assist Encon’s Business Managers and Marketing Department in the development of catalog and other advertising programs.Effectively manage distributor partners and/or manufacturers representatives, including but not limited to establishment of their goals and targets and subsequent follow up to ensure success.Complete follow-up on all designated potential sales opportunities and product leads identified for the territory.Assist in preparation of proposals and negotiations with customers as would be appropriate for the specific region.Identify and recommend additional channels of distribution for Encon Safety Products to evaluate sales of .Participate in additional corporate support efforts as deemed necessary by Encon Management. Business Strategy:The individual must be able to:Develop strategies for sales growth in all targeted accounts.Develop Encon business to achieve market share goals.Implement specific product strategies including new product recommendations as will be required and determined by management.Consistently evaluate and recommend adjustments in distribution network to maximize Encon market penetration.Location(s)Brazil, IN; Moline, IL; Milan, IL; Cleveland, OH; Chicago Heights, IL; E Peoria, IL; Euclid, OH; El Paso, IL; Goodfield, IL; Blue Ash, OH; Hillsboro, OH; Rock Island, IL; Delaware, OH; Circleville, OH; East Peoria, IL; East Moline, IL; BRISTOL, IN; Bolingbrook, IL; Freeport, IL; Princeton, ILRequirementsQualifications:Education and/or Experience:Sales Skills:The individual must be entrepreneurial and assertive and possess the experience, skills, and attitude to be able to achieve Encon’s market share goals. Language Skills:The individual must have the:Ability to read and interpret documents including, but not limited to, training; installation, operation and maintenance (IOM’s); and procedure manuals.Ability to write reports and complete daily correspondence.Ability to speak effectively before groups of people such as employees of a customer’s organization.Ability to interface in a responsive manner over the telephone and in person.Ability to handle difficult customer situations with diplomacy. Mathematical Skills:Have the ability to calculate figures and amounts such as proportions and percentages. Travel:The position will demand extensive overnight travel away from the home as logistics of the region demand, such as Sales Management will determine. Education and/or Experience:College degree or equivalent with related sales experience in the safety, industrial and/or commercial business preferred. Physical Demands:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to move from location to location, talk, and hear. Extensive walking throughout customer facilities is a regular requirement. The employee is regularly required to drive and/or travel. The employee is occasionally required to sit. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Disclaimer Statement:The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of the work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified#LI-GS1Travel RequirementsUp to 50%

title: Clinical Appeals Manager (RN)
description:

Identifies problems and recommends solutions.Advises key management on process and system enhancement opportunitiesProvides feedback to Director on operational concerns and oversight of team membersAssist in planning and execution of monthly staff meetingsExemplifies the core values of Managed ResourcesOther duties as assigned.

title: CRA Officer (Community Reinvestment Officer)
description:

title: Operational Meteorologist
description:
Thousands of users trust our fast-growing weather safety platform across school districts, cities, universities, golf courses, and other industries. Our software and connected hardware enable rapid decision-making for organizations facing the threat of weather disruption: How long can I wait to pull players off the field for the nearby storm? How should I modify activities to prevent heat stress injuries? When can operations safely resume on the tarmac? How can I be sure my staff adheres to a weather policy?In the Operational Meteorologist role, you will be a pivotal player in the overall success of our customer’s experience. We are looking for someone who has demonstrated success in high-pressure weather forecasting situations and can simplify complex weather forecasts into digestible and actionable information. Ideal candidates will possess first-class communication and relationship-building skills, as well as strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
What you'll do:Forecasting for a wide variety of customers, from school districts and cities to professional sports teamsFielding inbound calls and emails requesting forecasts and/or weather-related questionsHelping our customers make decisions around the weather: Do we cancel or delay the game? What is today's heat safety risk? How will the weather impact our tournament this weekend?Preparing daily proactive forecasts and daily shift reportsAssist with other customer support tasks
Requirements:BS degree in Meteorology or Atmospheric SciencesComfortable in a fast-changing work environmentHighly organized and detail-orientedEnergized and motivated by spending time with customers and helping them make decisionsPlease note, this is not a remote job; our office is in Dallas, TX.
Nice to haves:Familiarity with our core markets including school districts, parks and recreation departments, golf courses, and universitiesExperience in broadcast or operational meteorology
Benefits:Casual, flexible work environment. Our office is currently located in The Centrum.Comprehensive benefits. We offer competitive health insurance plans, 401(k), and a suite of voluntary benefits.Engaging culture. Weekly all-hands, fun events like Fair Day, monthly lunch-and-learns, happy hours, and more.Grow with us. We’re growing rapidly, and yet we have a massive amount of work and opportunity ahead.

title: Technical Product Manager - Cloud
description:

title: Financial Operations & Decision Support Manager
description:
Title: Financial Operations & Decision Support Manager

State Role Title: 19034

Hiring Range: Starting Pay $85k (salary commensurate with experience)

Pay Band: 5

Agency: Dept Behavioral Health/Develop

Location: Western State Hospital

Agency Website: https://dbhds.virginia.gov/facilities/wsh/

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

Who we are:

Western State Hospital (WSH) is the state of art psychiatric hospitals operating since 1828 under Department of Behavioral Health and Development Services. WSH is 302-bed Joint Commission accredited facility located in the beautiful Shenandoah Valley within 30-minutes of major university towns and is affiliated with the University of Virginia-Department of Psychiatric Medicine and provides a training ground for professionals from other colleges and universities in the fields of nursing, social work, psychology, and activities therapy.

Western State Hospital is seeking a qualified and experienced candidate as a Financial Operations and Decision Support Manager to managing, organizing, and directing of key functions of the Fiscal Department for Western State Hospital (WSH) and the Commonwealth Center for Children and Adolescents (CCCA).

Responsibilities

This position is responsible for the managing, organizing, and directing of key functions of the Fiscal Department on behalf of Western State Hospital (WSH) and the Commonwealth Center for Children and Adolescents (CCCA); responsible for budgeting, financial analysis and reporting; cost accounting; annual ARMICS review; internal and external audits; and data analytics; responsible for assuring compliance with applicable federal and state laws to include the Commonwealth Accounting Policy and Procedure (CAPP) manual; responsible for communicating financial information to WSH, CCCA, and DBHDS Executive management, department heads, managers, and supervisors, as well as other stakeholders; and working with the Payroll Manager and Accounting Manager to assure compliance with the Agency Risk Management and Internal Control Standards (ARMICS) on an ongoing basis and coordinating the audit with the DBHDS Comptroller’s office. This position will also assist in the development/preparation of the annual operating budget; perform/analyze monthly payroll and “all other” expense projects on a monthly basis and determining funding adequacy considering salary and benefit increases and other planned distributions. This position will report to the CFO.

This role comes with a comprehensive and competitive state benefit package that includes: 13 paid holidays.

 Annual, sick, and family and personal leave. Paid short-term and long-term disability. Health, dental and life insurance with a generous contribution from the State keeping premiums very competitive. Enrollment in the Virginia Retirement System. Malpractice covered by the Commonwealth of VA/Legal Representation. Reimbursement for Continuing Education Credits. Moving and Relocation available.

Minimum Qualifications

 Candidate must be graduated from college with a bachelor's degree in accounting or a related field. The candidate must be able to effectively apply generally accepted accounting principles to various accounting transactions and system processes and respond appropriately to information and audit requests. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience and knowledge of financial internal controls and be able to develop appropriate policies and procedures to safeguard facility assets. Candidate should have budgeting experience and be able to prepare financial reports, perform data analysis, and make financial projections. Proficiency in Excel is a must, and experience with data reporting tools like Microsoft Power BI will be an added advantage. The ideal candidate should also have a thorough understanding of the Hospital's billable revenue, the Medicare Cost Report for accurate and timely filing, state budgeting processes, and fund accounting. Good communication skills, both written and verbal, are a must-have for this position, and the candidate should be able to work effectively with a diverse group of employees. Candidate must have extensive supervisory experience of accounting staff and other fiscal support.

Additional Considerations

 Extensive knowledge of public sector accounting systems, or healthcare is preferred. CPA designation for MBA level of education is preferred. Knowledge of Hospital operations, including the revenue cycle, is preferred. Bilingual in Spanish Veteran or Veteran spouse.

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

Western State Hospital is a tobacco free facility in all state buildings and on facility grounds. Submit a completed state application online at https://virginiajobs.peopleadmin.com/. if assistance is needed, contact by email Samantha.Leep@dbhds.virginia.gov. To apply for a job, you must make sure that your online application is complete. MISSING INFORMATION IS AN INCOMPLETE APPLICATION AND WILL NOT BE PROCESSED. Please make sure all telephone numbers/addresses are current and up-to-date. REMEMBER YOUR CONFIRMATION NUMBER. You have not completed applying for this position until you receive a confirmation number. If you are connected to a printer, print the confirmation number so that you can track the progress of your application and click on OK. If you are not connected to a printer, write down the confirmation number and then click on OK. Reasonable accommodations for the application and/or interview processes are available upon request to persons with disabilities per the Americans with Disabilities Act. Minorities, Veterans and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply. WSH is an EEO compliance facility.

In accordance with Executive Directive #18, as a condition of employment, the Commonwealth of Virginia requires all Executive Branch employees, including new hires and contract workers, to disclose their vaccination status. If you are the selected candidate, proof of vaccination will be required during new employee orientation on your first day of work. Employees that are not vaccinated must be tested weekly.

Commonwealth’s Alternate Hiring Process: In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their Certificate of Disability (COD) provided by a Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor within the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their Certificate of Disability. If you need to get a Certificate of Disability, use this link: https://www.vadars.org/drs/cpid/PWContact.aspx, or call DARS at 800- 552-5019, or DBVI at 800-622-2155.

DBHDS Facilities are no longer required to ensure that all staff members are vaccinated for COVID-19. However, facilities encourage and educate staff on the benefits and offer COVID - 19 vaccination programs to staff, residents, clients. Employees may be required to disclose immunization status for purposes of infection prevention and/or management of outbreaks. Upon acceptance of a job offer, new recruits will be asked to disclose their vaccination status (and for those fully vaccinated, proof of vaccination) during the pre-employment process. If you have questions, please contact the Office of Human Resources.

Contact Information

Name: Samantha Leep

Phone: 540-32-8306

Email: samantha.leep@dbhds.virginia.gov

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note: Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

title: Structural Design Engineer
description:
Title: Structural Design EngineerPosition Type: Full TimeCompany: MKM & Associates Structural EngineeringLocation: Rohnert Park, CAPosting Date: April 5, 2024Pay Range: The annual base pay range for this role is $75,000 - $110,000.
Please email cover letter, resume and salary requirement to info@mkmassociates.com. Use “Structural Design Engineer” in the subject line. No phone calls please.
OverviewMKM & Associates is a structural engineering firm located in the heart of wine country. With 40+ years of work experience encompassing civic, commercial, educational, healthcare, historic, hospitality, residential, and winery/brewery markets we offer full-service design, drafting, and collaboration with sub-consultants to ensure that our clients receive the highest level of service. Visit our website at www.mkmassociates.com
PositionWe are currently looking for an experienced Structural Design Engineer. This position will give you the opportunity to work under licensed Structural Engineers with growth potential available.
General Job Duties (including but not limited to):Develop and design structural systems for buildings, bridges, and other structures using computer-aided design (CAD) software.Analyze blueprints, plans, and specifications to determine the requirements for structural design, including the size and strength of materials, building codes, and safety regulations.Conduct structural calculations to determine the loads, stresses, and forces that will be placed on the structure, and design solutions that will ensure the safety and stability of the building.Create detailed construction documents, including drawings and specifications, that provide contractors with the information they need to construct the structure.Work with other design team members, including architects and mechanical engineers, to ensure that the structural design is integrated with other building systems.Evaluate existing structures to determine if they are safe for continued use and develop plans to repair or retrofit structures as necessary.Attend site visits and meetings with clients and contractors to discuss design plans and construction progress.Use specialized software to simulate the behavior of structures under different conditions and make design modifications as necessary.Collaborate with project managers to develop project timelines and budgets and ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget.Keep up to date with new developments in structural design and construction methods and incorporate new techniques and technologies into designs as appropriate.
Physical Demands The position may require the employee to perform the following physical activities:﻿Sitting or standing for extended periods.Using a computer for extended periods.Lifting and carrying up to 25 pounds.Using manual dexterity to operate office equipment and handle paperwork.
Job QualificationsIt is preferred for applicants to have at least three years’ experience (5+ years is strongly preferred) in Structural Design of residential & commercial low-rise buildings working with timber, concrete, steel, and masonry construction materials.Excellent verbal, written communication, and computer skills a plus.Experience with engineering programs such as ETABS & ADAPT as well as AutoCAD is desirable.

title: PRN Registered Nurse
description:
Title: PRN Registered Nurse

State Role Title: 49113

Hiring Range: $45.32 + 2nd/3rd shift differentials/holidays differentials/weekend differentials

Pay Band: 5

Agency: Dept Behavioral Health/Develop

Location: Southern Va Mental Health Inst

Agency Website: https://dbhds.virginia.gov/facilities/svmhi/

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

This is an entry level position for Registered Nurses (RN) who are new graduates or have minimal RN experience. This is a PRN position (up to 28 hours/week) with no benefits.

The Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental services support individuals by promoting recovery, self-determination, and wellness in all aspects of life. DBHDS operates 12 facilities: 8 behavioral health facilities for adults, a training center, a psychiatric facility for children and adolescents, a medical center, and a center for behavioral rehabilitation. State facilities provide highly structured, intensive services for individuals with mental illness, intellectual disability, or need substance use disorder services. DBHDS is committed to a life of possibilities for all Virginians. This position will work at Southern Virginia Mental Health Institute, a 72-bed Joint Commission accredited State Mental Health Facility, located in Danville, VA.

DBHDS is seeking dedicated Registered Nurse Professionals. A Registered Nurse I at DBHDS is responsible for providing advanced nursing care for patients with psychiatric disorders in accordance with hospital policies and procedures, as well as nursing standards and regulations.

Registered Nurses are also responsible for safely implementing the use of Seclusion/Restraints including knowledge of physical/emotional risk factors of the patients served at the facility.

HIRING FOR ALL SHIFTS TO WORK PRN, WEEKENDS AND/OR HOLIDAYS! THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY FOR THOSE WHO PREFER WEEKEND-ONLY OPTIONS! SHIFT DIFFERENTIALS FOR 2ND AND 3RD SHIFTS! SHIFT DIFFERENTIALS FOR WEEKEND SHIFTS!!

Minimum Qualifications

Successfully complete BLS, Therapeutic Options (TO) and other required training upon employment at facility.

Demonstrate effective interpersonal communication skills, team focused care and professional approach.

Displays the ability to plan, implement and evaluate care utilizing knowledge of pharmacology, psychiatric and physical disorders, and cultural needs of the individual psychiatric patient.

Presents good clinical knowledge and resource to staff.

Ability to delegate, supervise, evaluate nursing processes to help solve complex problems.

Current and in good standing Registered Nurse license to practice nursing in the Commonwealth of Virginia, or license eligible; multi-state compact endorsement is accepted.

License or eligibility for license to practice as a Registered Nurse by the Virginia Department of Health Professions.

A valid driver’s license is required and must remain valid throughout employment.

Additional Considerations

Experience as a Registered Nurse in a psychiatric, healthcare facility, acute care, long-term or correctional setting.

Veterans and people with National Service.

Bilingual fluency in Spanish and English.

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

Applicants must list all relevant experience that you wish to be considered for this position. Applicants will be provided confirmation of receipt when your application and/or resume is submitted. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

A fingerprint-based criminal history check and reference checks are required for the selected candidate for this position. Under Virginia Code

37.2-314 and 37.2-408.1, the Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services is prohibited from employing or using as volunteers, persons who have been convicted of specific “barrier” crimes or persons who may be the subject of pending “barrier” charges.

DBHDS facilities are no longer required to ensure that all staff members are vaccinated against COVID-19. However, facilities encourage and educate staff on the benefits, and continue to offer COVID-19 vaccination programs to staff, residents/clients. Employees may be required to disclose immunization status for purposes of infection prevention and/or management of outbreaks. Upon acceptance of a job offer, new recruits will be asked to disclose their vaccination status (and for those fully vaccinated, proof of vaccination) during the pre-employment process. If you have any questions, contact the Office of Human Resources.

Commonwealth’s Alternate Hiring Process: In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their Certificate of Disability (COD) provided by a Certified Rehabilitation Counselor with the Department of Aging and Rehabilitative Services (DARS). Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS, to get their Certificate of Disability. To obtain a Certificate of Disability go to: https://www.vadars.org/drs/cpid/PWContact.aspx, or call DARS at 800-552-5019. Reasonable accommodations are available to persons with disabilities during the application and/or interview process per the Americans with Disabilities Act. Contact Human Resources at (434) 773-4208 for assistance.

DBHDS is an equal Opportunity Employer. Employment opportunities are open to all regardless of race, sex, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, political affiliation, genetics, or disability. Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities, Veterans, and people with National Service experience are encouraged to apply. EEO/AA/TTY.

SVMHI uses Form I-9 and E-Verify in the verification of eligibility for employment.

SVMHI is a smoke and vape-free facility in all buildings and outside facility grounds.

Contact Information

Name: Human Resources

Phone: 434-421-3060

Email: svmhihr@dbhds.virginia.gov

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note: Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

title: ComEd - Maint Mech 0 Cert Fleet
description:
Description

Job Description

At Exelon, we've got a place for you!

Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.

Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!

Primary Duties And Accountability

Responsible for fleet maintenance. Responsible for adherence to all governmental regulations and compliance with company policies and procedures. Performs other related duties as assigned or required. 

This position will work in various ComEd territories.

Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS:

Candidate must have demonstrated a thorough working knowledge of the operation, maintenance, diagnosis and repair of the company vehicles, work equipment, and specialized tools through formalized trainingCandidate must be capable of performing heavy manual labor without restriction. Candidate must have the ability to succeed formal training and schooling sessionsCandidate must have demonstrated safe behaviorCandidate must have a valid CDL Class A drivers license with Hazmat, Tanker, Doubles, and Passenger endorsements and retain thereafterCandidate must be capable of effective oral, written, and verbal electrical communicationCandidate must be capable of working without direct supervision. 

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with fluid power hydraulics4 A.S.E (Automotive Service Excellence) certifications or experience with diesel-hydraulic vehicles

At ComEd, Safety is always our top priority. For safety reasons, manufacturers set weight limitations on much of the equipment used in this position, including fall protection and buckets (generally, no more than 315 pounds). We cannot allow anyone who does not meet the manufacturers’ weight requirements to use our equipment. We administer our safe weight program in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations

title: Manager, Corporate Vertical Sales
description:
At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you’ll have the opportunity to create exceptional, meaningful work and problem solve with innovative team members by your side. Together, you’ll help our customers get the high-quality gear they need to make the most of their adventures. We are BUILT FOR THE WILD™.

The Manager, Corporate Sales will lead a segment of YETI’s Corporate Sales outbound team focused within our Retail B2B segment. This person will lead a team of Account Managers assist in developing sales strategy, tracking sales and activity performance and motivating the team. This person will also be critical in recognizing and communicating trends across YETI’s Corporate retail customers.

Responsibilities

 Manage the overall day to day responsibilities, deliverables, and execution of the Corporate Sales team Help develop and track Key Performance Indicators that drive revenue results Coach and drive accountability across YETI Corporate Sales team Prepare and collaborate with other sales leaders on reporting and visibility needs Lead projects as required to achieve business objectives and goals.

Qualifications And Attributes

 Bachelor’s Degree required with a graduate degree preferred. At least 3 years of experience managing teams in a customer-centric sales organization, ideally at a consumer products company. Experience working within B2B sales or functions preferred. Experience working within a high growth business to deliver results on time and within budget. Strong management skills and ability to motivate a team. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to interface well with all levels, including senior leadership. Results driven, proactive, positive attitude, accountable and drives projects and tasks from assignment to completion. Proven ability to multitask and work well under pressure in fast-paced environments. Ability to escalate risks and problems/solutions to Director of Sales appropriately and transparently. Experience working with Salesforce & PowerPoint is required. Outstanding attention to detail and time management skills are essential. Proficient with Salesforce or other CRM tools and Microsoft Office including PowerPoint and Excel. Knowledge of EDI process and Point-Of-Sale retail metrics Knowledge of account/vendor compliance

HYBRID: position requires to candidate to be onsite 2-3 days a week at HQ off Southwest Parkway in Austin, TX

YETI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Our commitment to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is at the center of everything we do for our YETIzens. We embrace all applicants looking to bring their authentic selves to YETI and contribute to our mission of keeping the wild WILD. Find out more about our commitment to DE&I at yeti.com/dei.html
