Programs are designed in partnership with New York City Transit's departmental management and where appropriate, other MTA agencies, in response to mandates by Federal, State and City entities. Operations Training is seeking a highly motivated person to join the team of instructors at the Signals Learning Center.The instructor is responsible for the development and delivery of training programs in the classroom and at field locations. The instructor is also responsible for, but not limited to, supervising, and instructing students in math, electronics, fiber optic training as well as the operation, inspection, troubleshooting and maintenance of NYC Transit signal equipment; developing and writing lesson plans; and developing and maintaining training aids and mock-ups. The instructor will also be responsible for planning, organizing, and coordinating the delivery of training, both computer-based and instructor-led training. In addition, the instructor will maintain records and prepare reports and evaluations on trainees, prepare, and deliver formal presentations, review new technology contracts, and attend vendor training. The incumbent will cross-train in electronic instruction. The employee is eligible for overtime. Compensation:
Maintenance Supervisor (Signals)II Salary Range:

1st Year $112,717
2nd Year $114,313
3rd Year $118,338

Education and Experience:Position is only open to current Maintenance Supervisor I employees who have a permanent status in the title.
 Desired Skills:The instructor must have a thorough understanding of the methods and procedures used by the Division of Maintenance of Way/Signals/New Technology Signals for the inspection and maintenance of NYC Transit signals equipment found in interlocking towers, enclosures and field installations, including but not limited to troubleshooting techniques and repair procedures.Must have a thorough knowledge of NYC Transit's rules and regulations.Must be able to organize and present training material to an audience.Must possess effective writing, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.Must have a thorough knowledge of CBTC operations & procedures.Must have a thorough knowledge of SSI operations & procedures.Must have a thorough knowledge of PLC operations & procedures.Must have a thorough knowledge of UPS operations & procedures.Must have a thorough knowledge of SAG Corrector operations & procedures.Understanding of Fiber Optics (FO) & FO splicing.Basic industrial electronic component fundamentals.Use of oscilloscopes.OTDRs.Other Information:

title: Promotions Manager
description:
OrganizationIndiana Ready Mixed Concrete Association
Job TitleIRMCA Promotions Manager
Type of PositionHybrid with 50-70% travel per month (Minimal Overnight Trips)
Location RequirementCentral Indiana: Ideally within a 30-mile radius of Indianapolis.
Job SummaryAs the IRMCA Promotions Manager, you'll spearhead dynamic marketing initiatives to drive membership engagement and advance the utilization of Portland Cement Ready Mixed Concrete. By collaborating closely with the Executive Director and leveraging the IRMCA formal marketing plan, you'll orchestrate local, regional, and statewide promotional campaigns aimed at expanding the adoption of concrete solutions.
Primary Tasks and ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with the Executive Director to coordinate and execute promotional activities aligned with organizational objectives.Lead and collaborate with Association committees to elevate membership services and foster program development.Conceptualize and deliver compelling promotional and educational seminars, supplemented with visually captivating multimedia materials in line with the Association’s Marketing Plan.Provide timely assistance to member firms by furnishing technical information, promotional materials, and facilitating marketing calls.Proactively engage with key stakeholders in public and private sectors to advocate for increased concrete usage, targeting decision-makers through strategic marketing outreach.Drive the development and coordination of the IRMCA’s Annual Outstanding Achievement Awards Program, cultivating widespread industry participation and orchestrating awards presentations at the Annual Short Course meeting.Actively participate in IRMCA events and relevant construction industry gatherings to advance promotional objectives.Collaborate with regional promotional groups to organize impactful demonstrations and promotional events.Monitor and evaluate the efficacy of marketing and promotional efforts, collaborating with the Executive Director to enact necessary updates and revisions.Undertake additional promotional activities as assigned by the Executive Director and the Director of Promotion, contributing to the overall operational effectiveness of the IRMCA office.
Skills & AbilitiesEnthusiastic attitude with a dedication to continuous learning.Proactive self-starter with exemplary time management skills.Proficient understanding of marketing and promotion principles.Competent in developing and delivering engaging PowerPoint presentations.Strong public speaking skills to deliver impactful presentations to diverse audiences.Effective communication skills to engage with stakeholders across various sectors.Comprehensive knowledge of market segments and products relevant to advancing the use of ready mixed concrete.Proficient written communication skills for media outreach, report writing, promotional reporting, marketing material development, and newsletter creation.
Experience & Education/TrainingBachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience, preference given to Construction Management, Marketing, or Business.Demonstrated experience in marketing, promotion, and sales within the construction industry or related sectors preferred.Familiarity with design and construction industries is beneficial, though not essential.Prior work experience in the concrete or construction industry is preferred.Experience with HubSpot or other CRMs is advantageous.
Supervisory ResponsibilitiesThis position does not entail direct supervision of employees.
Salary & CompensationYearly Salary: $45,000 - $55,000Company Vehicle & Expenses: Provided by the association.Individual Health Insurance: Employee is covered by the association upon commencement of employment.Disability Insurance: Fully covered by the association upon commencement of employment.SEP Retirement Plan: After one year of service, the association contributes 6% towards the employee's SEP Retirement plan.
Submission Email Cover Letter and Resume to Executive Director, Chad Montgomery (cmontgomery@IRMCA.com).

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
description:
About SCAILSCAIL is a sales & marketing solutions startup that provides growing businesses an alternative solution to hiring in-house sales personnel. Instead of companies hiring their own salespeople and trying to tie together lead generation, management, tools, and benefits, they can outsource their sales development to SCAIL. We provide an all-in-one sales development service that combines modern AI tools for lead generation with the irreplaceable human touch of professional Sales Development Representatives (SDRs). The result is a steady stream of sales-qualified opportunities for our clients to close.
Job DescriptionWe are hiring a contracted SDR with the potential to grow to full-time if performance is stellar. This seasoned SDR should have enterprise-level experience that will assist our fast-growing European cybersecurity client to break into the U.S. market. Our client provides cutting-edge cybersecurity technologies for medium to large companies where contracts can exceed $500,000/year. Your job will be to begin outbound sales activities in the U.S. cybersecurity market to provide our client sales-qualified opportunities and appointments through qualifying and nurturing enterprise-level leads via cold email outreach, cold-calling, and social media interaction.Everything for you to be successful will be provided for you: domain emails, phone numbers, social media account access, Customer Relationship Manager (CRM), lead lists, training, product knowledge, etc. to generate a sales pipeline and grow their customer base. You will not be required to close the sales.This job is 100% remote, so as long as you have a computer and a reliable internet connection, you have everything you need to work for us.
ResponsibilitiesParticipate in a 1-2 week ramp-up period with our client where we will prepare for outbound activities by becoming intimately acquainted with their product offering, refine sales copies and guides, and identify their ideal customer profile (ICP) in multiple virtual meetings.Become a trusted advisor to our client’s prospects and customers.Qualify leads and produce appointments for our client.Work outbound leads with an expectation of doing ~60 touches per day.Demonstrate initiative, creativity, and collaboration in a startup environment.
Qualifications2-3 years of sales, sales/business development, outbound outreach experience, preferably in enterprise-level salesDesire to work in sales and a startup.Coachable, self-motivatedProfessional, efficient communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills (positive and personable).
OpportunitiesDevelop a high income selling a cutting-edge product that is fun to sell and talk about.Choose your own hours, work from wherever you want. This job is 100% results-based.Opportunities for additional responsibility and management experience as our client’s sales grow and/or we acquire more clients.We will help you gain and refine the skills you need to produce more qualified opportunities for our clients and maximize your income.Collaborative and supportive work environment.
CompensationThis role will initially be 100% commission-based with the potential to evolve into a base + commission position if we perform well for our client. Your commission will begin at 5%, which is the top-end of SDR commission rates.Our client’s contracts are commonly six-figures+ and the sales cycle typically occurs over 1-3 weeks. By our calculations, a successful SDR can provide 1-5 sales/month for our client, which could generate an income of $5k-$25k per month.Because your income will be 100% commission, your earning potential is uncapped, and your tenacity could net you more than $25k/month.
If you are a self-motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for sales and growth, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

title: Private Equity Analyst
description:

Augment Jobs sources job opportunities for its clients and submits applications on their behalf once the clients approve the role. Overview:We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Private Equity Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Private Equity Analyst, you will play a critical role in evaluating investment opportunities, conducting financial analysis, and supporting the overall investment decision-making process. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, financial modeling expertise, and a keen understanding of the private equity landscape.Responsibilities:Financial Analysis:Conduct comprehensive financial analysis, including building and maintaining complex financial models to evaluate potential investment opportunities.Analyze historical and projected financial statements, cash flow, and valuation metrics.Due Diligence:Perform due diligence on target companies, assessing industry dynamics, competitive positioning, and growth prospects.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze relevant information.Market Research:Stay abreast of industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities.Prepare market research reports to inform investment strategies and decisions.Investment Memo Preparation:Prepare detailed investment memoranda, outlining the investment thesis, risks, and potential returns.Present findings and recommendations to senior management and investment committees.Deal Execution:Assist in the execution of investment transactions, including mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts, and recapitalizations.Coordinate due diligence processes and work with legal and financial advisors.Portfolio Management:Monitor and report on the performance of existing portfolio companies.Work closely with portfolio management teams to identify value creation opportunities.Valuation and Exit Strategies:Participate in the valuation of portfolio companies and assess potential exit strategies.Evaluate exit opportunities, such as IPOs, secondary sales, and strategic exits.Risk Management:Identify and assess investment risks, proposing strategies to mitigate risks and enhance returns.Stay informed about regulatory changes and their potential impact on investments.
Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, or a related field; CFA or MBA is a plus.Previous experience in private equity, investment banking, or a related field.Strong financial modeling and valuation skills.Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.Effective communication and presentation skills.Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.

title: Senior Front-End Engineer
description:
*** This is a remote-first company and the role is remote, however this opening is hiring regionally in the Atlanta/Greater Atlanta, GA area. Only candidates in Atlanta/Greater Atlanta Area will be considered at this time. ________________________________________________________________________________ What's great about us:
We are a SaaS startup providing an all-in-one business management solution used daily by thousands of green industry professionals (landscapers, arborists, irrigation technicians, etc.) all across North America. Our customers use us to manage their customer records, perform estimates & sell work, schedule crews, invoice & receive payment, and understand critical data about their business like real-time profitability. Because of our Product, our customers have processed over $4 billion in revenue. The green industry is in the early innings of adopting CRM and field service software, and our product is enabling this industry's evolution.
We are looking for diverse-minded people who enjoy challenging and fulfilling work to join our mission in redefining an age-old industry. Our team is highly collaborative, innovative, supportive, and we have a lot of fun. Our core values are Growth Mindset, Customer Success, We Before Me, Simplicity, and Bias to Act; if this speaks to you, we want to meet you!
Our culture and growth has been recognized with multiple awards, it's a great time to join!
Inc. 5000: #97 of 2023 Southeast Regional America's Fastest Growing Companies. (Our second year in a row!)#12 of Built In's 2023 Best Places to Work: Top 50 start-ups in AtlantaInc Magazine's 2023 Best Places to WorkInc 5000 (America's fastest-growing private companies)- recognized in 2022 and 2021
The reason behind the role
We is looking for a talented Senior Front End Engineer to join our talented product development team. If you have solid experience in React and Redux and you are passionate about creating high quality features that wow our customers, we want to hear from you.
Outcomes you will drive:
Excellent implementation of design: Turn the ideas of product and design into reality with attention to detail.Good architectural principles: Lead the development of features, emphasizing modularity, reusability, and scalability.Growing the team's React and Redux expertise: Provide guidance on best practices, patterns, and code quality related to React and Redux development.Optimal frontend performance: Identify performance bottlenecks and implement optimizations to enhance the overall user experience.Valuable code reviews: Conduct code reviews and mentor other engineers to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
Does this sound like you?
Specific experience is less important than a demonstrable desire to learn and the ability to complete complex projects. However, a good candidate should have the following:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experienceProven experience as a Frontend Developer with a strong emphasis on React and Redux in complex applicationsExperience in Micro Frontends architecture and implementationProficiency in modern frontend technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+), and responsive web designExperience with build tools, package managers, and version control systems (e.g., Webpack, Babel, NPM, Git)Strong understanding of RESTful API design and integrationExcellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environmentStrong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholdersFamiliarity with agile development methodologies
A few ways to stand out...
Experience with Ruby on RailsKnowledge of containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g. Docker)Familiarity with state management libraries other than Redux (e.g. MobX)Contributions to open-source projects or a strong online presence in the developer community

title: Banking Operations Systems Analyst
description:
The Banking Operations Systems Analyst is responsible for assisting bank staff with deep technical support, implementation, and maintenance on banking operations products and services. This critical operational support role for the Bank will act as a liaison between software and service providers, banking teams, and bank staff to promote clear communication across the organization, transparency on our products and services, and overall support for the TM business.
ResponsibilitiesActs as a technical and software product expert for banking operations products and systems, deeply understanding how our operations systems function, interact with one another and how to troubleshoot complex client issues.Assists the Banking Operations teams with Jack Henry core banking problem resolution, investigating problems against previously understood issues and resolving as appropriate. If problem resolution requires vendor support, you will own the issue from start to finish, working with vendor and troubleshooting issue in tandem.Develop, execute, and maintain automated processes for high volume tasks via standardized vendor supported tools such as Macros and RPA, including reporting functions for Banking Operations teams.Continually supports all Banking Operations products and services, including primary interface with core service provider for deposit product related issues.Identify and implement process and system function improvements.Other duties as assigned.
Minimum QualificationsBachelor's Degree preferred.3-4 years of experience in Computer Science or Systems Management.Experience implementing Robotic Process Automation (RPA) technology.Database management experience preferred.Ability to develop and maintain knowledge of Treasury Management products and services.Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite applications required.Ability to communicate effectively with team members and external clients.Can work well under pressure with the capability to always remain calm and courteous, especially when handling difficult calls and requests.Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to offer recommendations and/or solutions to complex client inquires/issues.


About Fortis
At Fortis, we take great pride in providing our clients with a holistic and sophisticated banking experience. Our people enjoy being empowered with the ability to make a tangible impact in a progressive and less bureaucratic work culture that can often be a struggle for larger institutions. 
We strongly believe in hiring people greater than ourselves. We recognize, reward, and develop those individuals who make an outsized impact to the business. Our combined passion, hard work, and proactive thinking allows us to simultaneously empower our clients and each other.
Established in May 1997 and rebranded in 2016, Fortis is a high growth commercial bank located in Colorado and Utah. Our flagship office is in Denver, Colorado, and was designed as a place for our clients to relax while our banking teams offer solutions to exceed their goals. Each of our hand-selected and exceptionally talented teammates contribute to the heart of our company culture that combines banking expertise and personalized services to create an unparalleled level of client experience.
We have over $1.3 billion in total assets and are insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (the “FDIC”).We are ranked the 10th largest bank in the state of Colorado, the 859th largest bank in the nation, and we have three (3) locations and approximately 80 employees.
Learn more today at www.fortisprivatebank.com/careers.

title: Medical Assistant
description:
We are seeking a qualified Medical Assistant to join our team at Fountain Life to work as part of an integrated care team including nurses, nutrtitionists, health coaches, care coordinators and led by a longevity physician. The medical assistant will work closely with the physician to support optimal care of our members. This position is responsible for providing an excellent customer experience in a team-based environment while assisting in all aspects of medical practice under the direct supervision and responsibility of a physician. This position is responsible for the collection, communication and documentation of accurate patient information/data and maintaining medical records according to regulatory standards and organizational policies and procedures. The medical assistant will provide patient instructions as directed by the physician. Other responsibilities include coordinating requests for information, prescriptions, tests, and procedures and support of lab collection and diagnostics as needed. 
Key Responsibilities:
Documentation and filing of clinical records in the electronic health record.Assisting physician to capture and implement medical plans for members.Creating supplement orders through online dispensary.Management of prescription requests under the supervision of a physician and medication reconciliation.Collection of results from diagnostic laboratory portals.Functional Expertise:Proficient in medical terminology.HIPAA compliance certification.Strong multi-tasking skills. Attention to details even under pressure.Time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.Documentation management and ability to use electronic health records.Experience using diagnostic portals.Ability to work with strict confidentiality requirements, as well as utilize good judgment in the preparation and distribution of confidential information.People SkillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills for strong customer relationships.Ability to work well in a team environment.Ability to communicate clearly and professionally through both verbal and written skills.Education and Experience:Associates degree and previous MA experience2 years clinical experience in a physician’s office or ambulatory setting in lieu of degree/diplomaCCMA or RMA preferred.
Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
Fountain Life provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants in all company facilities without regard to race (including hair texture and hairstyles), color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, (or related medical conditions, including, but not limited to lactation), physical disability, mental and/or intellectual disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related), genetic information, or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
About Fountain Life
At Fountain Life, our mission is to make age 100 the new 60. We provide preventative, predictive and personalized medicine that enhances performance and turns back the clock. Our goal is for each of our members to live their most fulfilling, vibrant, and healthful version of themselves at every stage of life.Fountain Life focuses on proactive versus reactive care; with a world-class medical team that includes scientists and age-management pioneers who tap into the most advanced biotechnology, sensors, AI and therapeutics to enhance performance, boost longevity, and detect and pre-empt diseases including cancer, cardiac, metabolic, neurodegenerative disease, and more before they can cause harm.We are healthcare, reimagined.
What’s in it for you?
Fountain Life is a group of innovators led by Dr. Robert Hariri, Tony Robbins and Dr. Peter Diamandis. This unique opportunity allows you the chance to be a part of this disruptive health care environment and change the way medicine is done forever. As an employee you will also receive Fountain Health Insurance, which enables you to utilize many of the proactive health features Fountain Life has to offer.
Fountain Life lives by the following customer experience promises:
I will always strive to surprise and delight our members.I will over deliver and exceed members expectations.I will always consider a member’s emotional journey, the goal is for every member to feel safe, empowered, and educated. I will always be respectful of our member’s time and strive for a seamless experience. I will strive to make the entire journey intuitive, educational, and understandable. I will ensure that all results are simple to understand, data driven, and actionable.I will continually look for ways to digitize, dematerialize, demonetize, and democratize.I will remember that Fountain Life membership is exclusive and global. As such, our members will demand a 21st century experience. I will ask for feedback and always strive to be better. I will create memorable experiences.

title: Rental Linen & Uniform Sales
description:
Join a Thriving Sales Team at American Linen and Uniform Supply!
Are you eager to forge a bright career in sales? At American Linen and Uniform Supply, we cherish each team member and value the unique perspectives they bring. We've been in business for over 75 years, and we're still growing stronger every day! If you seek a workplace that respects and appreciates you, where your contributions make a real impact on the customers you serve, then we'd love to talk to you.
Discover Your Potential: Sales Representative Role Available
We're on the lookout for a Sales Representative to join our dynamic team at our Las Cruces, NM, location. We need someone who embodies the spirit of teamwork, driven by our company mission. We are YOUR Linen Company - and we believe in that so much, it's even our URL. As a Sales Representative, you'll have the chance to thrive in a family-owned business that upholds strong values and believes in personal and professional growth.
Your Calling: Building Relationships and Driving Success
In this role, you'll be a key driver, taking charge of prospecting and cold calling to win over new customers. With the freedom to set appointments and present exciting programs, you'll have ample opportunities to showcase your skills. But here's the best part - we're dedicated to investing in your growth and providing you with the tools you need to succeed. Our belief in hands-on training and continuous improvement means that we're constantly evolving to better serve our employees, customers, and community. Opportunities for advancement await, too.
Why American? A Company That Cares
At American, we're not just focused on your success at work, but also your happiness outside of it. Our employee-centric programs aim to enhance your life both personally and professionally.
If you're a forward-thinking individual who thrives on innovation, then this is your chance to make a real impact with a company that cares about your future.Join us at American Linen and Uniform Supply and let's make an incredible journey together. Apply now to take the first step towards an exciting and rewarding sales career!
We'll Offer:
Competitive Pay + Commission package including a $60,000/year salary plus uncapped commissions. Anticipated first-year earnings at plan are in excess of $80,000 per year, with average 3rd year earnings in the six figures!A company owned car so you don't have to drive the wheels off of yours.Paid time off and holidays.Retirement program.Medical insurance package.Disability and Life Insurance Packages.Career advancement opportunities.Ongoing training and development.An entrepreneurial work environment that you'll enjoy!
Bring your:
2 years of sales experienceHunter sales mentality - goal-driven, self-motivatedAbility to work independently is a mustStrong verbal, written, and presentation skillsA relentlessly positive attitudeStrong listening skillsValid driver's license and clean driving record
Does this sound like you? Then please apply online! NO PHONE CALLS, PLEASE.
About American Linen and Uniform Supply:
American Linen & Uniform Supply has been the premier linen and uniform supply company in Las Cruces, New Mexico for over 75 years. It has been home owned and operated by the Lutz family in Las Cruces, New Mexico since January 1, 1949. Although American Linen & Uniform Supply is based in Las Cruces, New Mexico, it has the capacity to serve customers all over the Southwest. Recently added service areas include Albuquerque, Bernalillo, Santa Fe, Los Lunas, Belen and Socorro, NM.To learn more about us, visit https://www.yourlinencompany.com

title: Secretary (Unit Secretary)
description:
Duties

Summary

Corrections professionals who foster a humane and secure environment and ensure public safety by preparing individuals for successful reentry into our communities. Our highly-skilled, diverse, and innovative workforce creates a strong foundation of safety and security. Through the principles of humanity and normalcy, we develop good neighbors.

Requirements

Qualifications

To be considered for the position, you must meet the following qualification requirements: Education: GL-05: Successfully completed 4 years of education above the high school level in any field for which high school graduation or the equivalent is the normal prerequisite is creditable at the GL-05. This education must have been obtained in an accredited business, secretarial or technical school, junior college, college or university. One year of full-time academic study is defined as 30 semester hours, 45 quarter hours, or the equivalent in a college or university, or at least 20 hours of classroom instruction per week for approximately 36 weeks in a business, secretarial, or technical school. GL-06: As a general rule, education is not creditable above GL-05 for most positions covered by this standard; however, graduate education may be credited in those few instances where the graduate education is directly related to the work of the position. OR Experience: GL-05 and GL-06: You must have at least one year of specialized experience equivalent in difficulty and complexity to the next lower grade level in federal service. To be creditable, this experience must have equipped the applicant with the particular qualifications to perform successfully the duties of the position, and must typically be in or related to the position to be filled. Some examples of this qualifying experience are: GL-05: Experience preparing, receiving, reviewing and verifying documents. Experience processing transactions and maintaining office records. Experience locating and compiling data or information from files and other data sources. GL-06: Experience receiving telephone calls and visitors, handling requests for information, processing incoming and outgoing materials such as correspondence, reports and memoranda. Experience editing and composing letters and reports, transcribing notes, and reviewing correspondence. Experience performing office automation duties using a personal computer, preparing a calendar, worksheets, typing a variety of documents such as letters, forms, schedules, meeting minutes, and maintaining computer files. Experience scheduling and maintaining appointments, coordinating meetings and conferences, making travel arrangements, and performing time and attendance functions. OR Combination of Education and Experience: GL-05 only: Have a combination of education and experience. This experience must have equipped you with the qualifications to perform the major duties of this position as described above. Only education in excess of the first 60 semester hours (i.e., beyond the second year) is creditable toward meeting the specialized experience requirement. One full academic year of study (30 semester hours) beyond the second year is equivalent to 6 months of specialized experience. If applicable, credit will be given for paid and unpaid experience. To receive proper credit, you must show the actual time (such as the number of hours worked per week) spent in activities. **Your eligibility for consideration will be based on your responses to the questions in the application.**

title: Respiratory Care Practitioner
description:
Description
$6,000 hiring bonus for eligible external hires that meet required qualifications and conditions for payment - this is in addition to the fantastic benefits and compensation package offered by Providence that begin on your first day of employment.
Respiratory Care Practitioner at Providence Child Center in Portland, OR - This position will work Full-time, Night shift
Perform Respiratory Care Services in accordance with departmental standards, policies and protocols.
Providence caregivers are not simply valued – they’re invaluable. Join our team at Providence Child Center and thrive in our culture of patient-focused, whole-person care built on understanding, commitment, and mutual respect. Why Join Providence?
Our best-in-class benefits are uniquely designed to support you and your family in staying well, growing professionally, and achieving financial security. We take care of you, so you can focus on delivering our Mission of caring for everyone, especially the most vulnerable in our communities.
Accepting a new position at another facility that is part of the Providence family of organizations may change your current benefits. Changes in benefits, including paid time-off, happen for various reasons. These reasons can include changes of Legal Employer, FTE, Union, location, time-off plan policies, availability of health and welfare benefit plan offerings, and other various reasons.
About Providence
At Providence, our strength lies in Our Promise of “Know me, care for me, ease my way.” Working at our family of organizations means that regardless of your role, we’ll walk alongside you in your career, supporting you so you can support others. We provide best-in-class benefits and we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone is essential, heard and respected. Together, our 120,000 caregivers (all employees) serve in over 50 hospitals, over 1,000 clinics and a full range of health and social services across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. As a comprehensive health care organization, we are serving more people, advancing best practices and continuing our more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable.
The amounts listed are the base pay range; additional compensation may be available for this role, such as shift differentials, standby/on-call, overtime, premiums, extra shift incentives, or bonus opportunities.

Providence has been serving the Pacific Northwest since 1856 when Mother Joseph of the Sacred Heart and four other Sisters of Providence arrived in Vancouver, Washington Territory. As the largest healthcare system and largest private employer in Oregon, Providence is located in areas ranging from the Columbia Gorge to the wine country to sunny southern Oregon to charming coastal communities to the urban setting of Portland.
Our award-winning and comprehensive medical centers are known for outstanding programs in cancer, cardiology, neurosciences, orthopedics, women's services, emergency and trauma care, pediatrics and neonatal intensive care. Our not-for-profit network also provides a full spectrum of care with leading-edge diagnostics and treatment, outpatient health centers, physician groups and clinics, numerous outreach programs, and hospice and home care.
Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to the principle that every workforce member has the right to work in surroundings that are free from all forms of unlawful discrimination and harassment on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. title: Civil Engineering - Utilities & Public Works Project Manager
description:
MWM DesignGroup is looking for a self-directed and proven Civil Infrastructure Project Manager experienced with public sector projects or an extremely independent and experienced Professional Engineer. You’ll have the opportunity to manage project teams, engage with our clients, and design much needed public infrastructure for the betterment of the Central Texas region.
We offer a variety of project and client types, with a focus on public entities. Recent and ongoing projects include utilities, storm water modeling and infrastructure, roadway, sidewalks/trails, and transit. A few of the notable projects we’ve worked on include: US 183 Bergstrom Expressway utility relocations, City of Bee Cave RR620 Trail, FM 2222 Expansion, City of Bastrop Downtown Streetscape and State Park Trail, City of Austin MLK Boulevard Transit Oriented Development Stormwater Improvements, City of Cedar Park Sidewalk Gaps Phases 3 through 5, and Cottonwood Wastewater Interceptor.
Here’s what we’d like to see on your cover letter and resume:4+ years of experience within public infrastructure engineering (2+ as Project Manager or additional PE experience)Registration as a Professional Engineer in Texas; or ability to obtain in 3 months of start dateProficiency in Utilities/Public Works project managementDesire to work with others in a team-oriented cultureExperience with Civil 3D, Bentley StormCAD/CivilStorm, and HEC-HMS and HEC-RASMWM DesignGroup outcompetes larger companies with an expert and enthusiastic team. Our focus on fun and enjoying our work, as well as our industry leading talent, further enhance our work environment. We promote and thrive in a culture of helpfulness and mentorship. A career at MWM DesignGroup is a place where your work will make a difference and where we will help you get to that next level of professional accomplishment.
If you enjoy working in a team environment and collaborating with other professionals including architects, engineers, surveyors and permitting expeditors to design high-impact public projects that define our community - then come join us at MWM DesignGroup!

title: Fulltime RN - TheraCare Home Health Houston
description:
Job Details

Job Location

Houston Market - Houston, TX

Position Type

Full Time

Salary Range

$85,000.00 - $95,000.00

Travel Percentage

Road Warrior

Description

RN Case Manager 

Job Summary:

The overall purpose of the Case Manager position is to conduct all aspects of supervision and management of patient care, including LVN and HHA supervision, case conferences and discharge planning to enable the agency to identify the medically related social and emotional needs of the patients. This position will promote patients’ potential during their home health episode and collaborates with physician, clinical team and patient in preparation for discharge.

Qualifications:

 Registered Nurse, licensed per the state requirements  Skills in communication, documentation, assessment, and social work methods and techniques.  Ability to read, write, and speak the English language. 

Qualifications

Case Manager Essential Functions:

 Supervises and manages all aspects of patient care, including LVN and HHA supervision.  1 year of Home Health Care experience preferred.  Coordinates the distribution of visits among all disciplines (SN, PT, OT, ST, MSW, HHA) after the Start of Care, Recertification or Resumption of Care is completed, and coordinates POC with the physician. Ensures all visits are provided as ordered.  Home Care Home Base experience preferred.  Initiates referrals to appropriate ancillary services i.e. podiatry, community services.  Facilitates interdisciplinary communication to ensure that patients’ needs and expectation for services provided are understood and to ensure optimization of service delivery and patient progress.  Leads weekly interdisciplinary case conferences for patient caseload and contributes to the development of care plans for patients.  Establishes specific social action plans and realistic goals for each patient consistent with medically related social and emotional needs.  With the Administrator, interprets and promotes patients' rights and the "Patients' Bill of Rights".  Coordinates all aspects of discharge planning with patients, clinical team and agency.  Provides individual and group help for patients/residents and families at times of adjustment, crisis or particular need.  Completes all necessary and supportive documentation-assessments, evaluations, visit notes and discharges, in accordance with state and federal regulations.  Ability to function as a team leader/role model.  Serves on various committees as requested by Administrator.  Has reviewed TheraCare Home Health Clinical Policies and Procedures on Abuse Prevention and knows the employee's responsibility to enforce it.  Responsible for assuring patient safety.  Performs other duties/tasks as assigned. 

RN essential functions:

 Every SOC, ROC and recertification will be reported to the team via HIPAA-compliant text messaging or email to include discipline orders, frequencies and any pertinent information the team needs to provide care.  All OASIS documentation will be completed and synched by 9:00AM the following day, 7 days per week.  All RNs may be required to participate in the on-call weekend rotation, including PRN staff. The size of each branch will determine the frequency of on call responsibility.  Full time staff may be required to work a minimum of one major and one minor holiday each year and could have additional holiday coverage requirements depending on the size of branch and number of staff in the agency location.  PRN staff may be required work one major and one minor holiday each year, may be required to work at least 2 weekend days each month, and complete a minimum of 5 visits each month unless on an approved leave of absence status, depending on the needs of their location. 

 We are an Equal opportunity employer; We offer an excellent benefit plan to include 401K with match, CEU reimbursement, vacation, sick, holidays, medical, dental, and supplemental insurance Plans as well as a Highly competitive compensation package.

title: Associate Director of Events
description:
ABOUT LAW ROCKSFounded in 2009, Law Rocks is a nonprofit organization that promotes youth music education and raises funds for local nonprofits via a world tour of battle of the band rock concerts – starring legal professionals. Law Rocks concerts have raised over $7 million dollars and been held in 29 cities. Law Rocks U.S arrived in Los Angeles in2012 with a single show, and now tours to a dozen annually.
ABOUT THE POSITIONAs one of two event leads, this role is responsible for the successful execution of half of the tour dates on the Law Rocks US calendar. In addition to creating successful and ever-improving concert events, the Associate Director of Events is the primary point of contact for band members and firms; building relationships with contacts in designated cities from year to year is a vital part of this position. The Associate Director of Events works at the direction of the Director. This is an ideal role for an individual who enjoys different types of work, travel, music, and giving back.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSHonest, trust-worthy, and ethical.Strong work ethic – you like to be busy with a variety of tasks.Efficient; ability to handle a high volume of detailed tasks and email.Strong written and oral communication skills.Highly organized; strong attention to detail as well as the ability to see the big picture.Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work well with all different types of people and handle situations with diplomacy and warmth, even in busy periods.Motivated and proactive, able to identify priorities and shift them as needed.Comfortable with numbers and basic financial reporting.Comfortable with and able to execute physical tasks such as packing and transporting road cases, taking inventory of merch, setting up signage, etc.Able to handle unexpected problems and come up with solutions, particularly at the live events.Undergraduate degree is preferred.Experience in live events is a bonus.Experience in frequently used tools is a bonus: Asana, Canva, Eventbrite, Salesforce, Slack, Squarespace, Typeform, Microsoft Office (particularly Excel).
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITSHourly rate $30 - $40 per hour. This position works 30 hours per week. Benefits include flexible hours, sick time, vacation time, and monthly phone and internet stipend. Position is mostly remote, with 1- 4 days at the Law Rocks office in Reseda required per month, as well as 6-12 trips per year for leading/assisting on tour dates.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Event PlanningOversees the planning and execution of 6+ Law Rocks tour dates each year; 3+ in the spring and 3+ in the fall.Logistics and Event Execution: Ensure all necessary communications are executed for a successful event. Lead all preparation for tour dates including merch inventory, packing show cases, and prepping event materials. Will travel to their 6+ cities each year to a run the event on the day of show; will travel to an additional 3+ cities a year to assist with other tour dates.Venue Communications: Assist with research and booking of venues. Maintain consistent communications with events and production team at venue regarding all details and logistics.Vendors: Research and negotiate with all needed vendors – catering, photographer, videographer, backline rental, merch workers, etc.Host and Judge: Hire a host for each tour date. Research and recruit members for Rock Panel of Judges. Execute communications with these key contacts. Prep and present host talking points.Nonprofits: Serve as liaison to nonprofit representative at each chosen nonprofit as well as the Music Matters grant recipients. This may include handling logistics and communications for youth or special opening acts. Band ManagementRepresent Law Rocks as the first and most frequent contact for bands. Build relationships with band members, ensure they receive the communication and support needed.Band Recruitment: Maintain band recruitment information in Salesforce. Using both existing and new contacts, ensure Call for Bands reach the widest possible audience, via personal outreach as well as strategizing new methods as needed. Ensure potential leads on new bands are recorded and followed up with.Band Communication: Ensure band members are informed regarding all important details. Respond to all questions and concerns. Provide ideas and support for band fundraising. Execute Kick Off welcome calls.Band Experience: Build relationships with band members and key firm personnel. Provide support and a friendly contact at the organization. Consistently evaluate ways to improve band experience, both in the leadup to the event and at the show itself.Administrative Support: Create and maintain band applications, review playlists, field marketing requests and connect firm marketing contacts with Associate Director of Marketing as needed. Marketing and DevelopmentEnsure a successful event by managing the fundraising aspect of each tour date as well as coordinating marketing efforts with the Associate of Marketing and Development.Sponsor Management: Point of contact for all sponsorships brought on by participating bands; process paperwork and invoices. Ensure sponsors receive all perks included with their package. Communicate marketing perks to Associate Director of Marketing and ensure they are received.Marketing and Promotions: Ensure all marketing collateral is received and available to the Associate Director of Marketing in a timely fashion. Review and approve email, event page, and social media promotions created by the Associate Director of Marketing; communicate any marketing leads, contacts, or ideas to them based on specific show needs.Fundraising: Monitor fundraising for each tour date. Proactively identify any issues regarding the status of ticket sales, donations, and band sponsorships and troubleshoot. Create final reports for charity donations, and each event with all fund types reconciled.Leaderboard Management: Execute daily calculations and reports on fundraising via Salesforce, publishing on event site. Communicate regarding pending funds with the rest of the team.Salesforce: Update and maintain all records in Salesforce, including, but not limited to: contacts, accounts, all opportunities, payments, and custom fields.Research: May assist with identifying potential sponsors, grants, and donors for the organization. Help gather soft leads on new sponsor opportunities. May conduct early sponsor outreach.

title: Instructional Coach
description:
Des Moines Public Schools is seeking an Instructional Coach.

Job Summary

Instructional Coaches support job-embedded professional development through collaborative and individual learning cycles, which provide a structure for gradually releasing teachers to learn new skills independently. Instructional Coaches engage in co-planning, modeling, and co-teaching lessons; as well as observing, providing feedback, and coaching classroom instruction. Instructional Coaches support implementation of district initiatives directed at strengthening core instruction through the common language of effective teaching practices.

Successful Candidates For This Position Will Possess

Valid Iowa teaching license with appropriate endorsement.

At least three years of teaching experience with at least one year of teaching experience with the Des Moines Public Schools.

Highly Qualified Candidates For The Position Will Possess

Master’s degree, preferably in effective teaching or adult learning/facilitation.

Experience and knowledge of designing, presenting, and facilitating adult learning experiences

Please see attached job descripton for further information on functions of the position along with educational and experience requirements.

Position Details

Contract days vary by assignment

7.75 hours

Salary schedule is attached..

Candidates offered employment will be compensated based on skills, work experience and education.

Des Moines Public Schools offers a generous benefits package including:

IPERS

Enrollment in IPERS (Iowa Public Employee Retirement System)--a defined benefit plan

Insurance Benefits 

Single and Family Health Insurance at no cost to the employee during the first plan year of employment (July 1 - June 30). title: Sales Assistant (Full-Time)
description:
Description

Want a challenging, inclusive work culture that emphasizes personal development and recognition? Are you a motivated, goal-oriented professional looking to take an exciting and rewarding step towards greatness in your career? New Home Star may be the place for you!

Our company is looking for a New Home Sales Assistant with experience in sales, customer service, and/or real estate to add to our nationwide team. As a New Home Sales Assistant, you have the opportunity to participate in the building of the American Dream. New Home Star is the largest privately owned seller of new homes in America. You can join us in a role in assisting the sales team for a division in the capacity of staffing the model, administrative tasks, and marketing assistance. Your role in this process is crucial, as you will act as a resource to the sales team. This role is located in Lady Lake, FL with our builder partner, Sun Communities.

Why New Home Star?

At New Home Star, our number one core value is to provide excellent careers for our people! By joining our team, you will see this value emphasized in all aspects of your career.

 Development Potential - opportunities for growth into full-time roles and continuous learning.  Award-Winning Culture - with thoughtful recognition and opportunities to participate in local and national team bonding events.  Excellent Health & Wellness Benefits- access to our range of benefits and wellness program, generous paid time off, and an exceptional employee assistance program.  Volunteer Opportunities - encouraged time and financial resources to give back to your local community in meaningful ways. 

Pay Structure & Benefits

This is a full-time job with an hourly pay of $23. Saturday availability is required. Advancement to Sales Consultant role after 3-6 months. Paid time off- vacation time, paid sick and safe time(PSST), and paid company holidays. Access to Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance. Comes with generous company contributions to premiums (subject to all eligibility requirements). Options for Health Savings Account with a company contribution or Flexible Spending Account; for medical and dependent care expense. Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability Insurance. Employee Assistance Program is available to you and members of your household. The EAP provides resources to help with childcare and elder care, financial and legal assistance, counseling and well-being coaching, personal and professional development. 401(k) retirement plan with a company match on your contributions. Student Loan Resources, the ability to control and prioritize your financial wellness with the assistance of Peanut Butter. Available Discounts for both your daily and splurge expense through PerkSpot. Negotiable gas stipend for traveling available. 

Requirements

New Home Star is seeking an educated, motivated, and goal-oriented sales professional to assist our sales team. If you fit the requirements below, you are an ideal match for this position!

Must have weekend availability. High School diploma is required, some college is preferred. 1-3 years of experience in an administrative or professional role is preferred. Extreme attention to detail and time management skills are a necessity. Ability to multitask and prioritize projects will be needed in order to be successful in this role. Experience with MS Office Suites such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Background checks required. 

Responsibilities

Staff the sales office location and provide exceptional customer service and information to any visitors. General office duties, including answering phones and responding to emails. Greeting office visitors and clients as they walk into the office. The ability to succeed in a high customer traffic environment. The ability to build rapport quickly with each customer. A base understanding of current technology for both reporting and social media. This position requires some Saturday and Sunday work hours. 

Applying Instructions

Ready to take the next step in your career? Follow the link below to check out New Home Star’s Careers Page! Please note, you only need to apply to one job ad, and list the other areas of interest you currently see posted. When applying there will be an option to list all of your areas of interest.

https://www.newhomestar.com/careers

Excited to learn more about our award-winning company? Check out our social media profiles! You can find New Home Star on LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and even Youtube.

https://www.newhomestar.com/company/about

The preceding job description is not a comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities required of a new home sales assistant.

New Home Star does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other reason prohibited by law in the provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Not open to third-party recruitment agencies.

title: Renewal Manager
description:
About Our Company:Stova is an award-winning end-to-end event technology company, focused on creating innovative solutions for in-person, virtual and hybrid events and providing insight to event planners and organizers about the data driven behind their event. With every meeting and event, Stova creates transformative experiences that enable their customers, attendees, and sponsors to make valuable, face-to-face connections. Companies of all sizes entrust Stova to solve all their event challenges from small intimate gatherings to massive events with 1000 attendees. For more information, visit www.stova.io
Position Summary:Stova is looking for an innovative, self-driven, detail-oriented, highly organized Renewal Manager with a mind geared towards retention, customer care, and identifying expansion opportunities within their customer base. As a Renewal Manager you will be accountable for retaining and managing a high volume of accounts.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:· Acting as primary account owner for all things Stova while holding a high standard of accountability and professionalism· Retaining and expanding customer revenue by delivering value· Leverage marketing automation solutions to communicate to high volume, low touch account base.· Owning success of their clients’ event programs with their desired outcomes in mind· Balancing customer advocacy and Stova company advocacy in support of collective goals· Maintaining updated knowledge of Stova’s product and messaging as the customer advisor
Education, Experience, & Skills Required:· Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and professional industry working experience.· Minimum of 1 years of previous account management/renewal management experience preferred. Experience in the global event management industry and/or Software as a Service companies is a plus.· Must have a strong work ethic and be results driven, as well as have flexibility and strong interpersonal skills.· Ability to multitask and work efficiently and effectively to meet required deadlines.· Highly organized and able to effectively manage large volumes of client accounts.· Enjoys a competitive and fast-changing entrepreneurial environment.· Ability to communicate (verbal and written) effectively with clients and internal team members.· Proven track record of exceeding or meeting sales quota· High level of technical aptitude. Ability to understand and communicate with clients on a semi-technical level.· Excellent English written and spoken language skills
Behaviors & Abilities Required:· Strong communication & interpersonal skills· Ability to collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams· Comfortable advising within a fast-paced work environment· Understands the importance of responsiveness· Entrepreneurial, authentic, and collaborative
Our success is based on the respectful, fair treatment of all employees, candidates, clients, and vendors regardless of differences. We foster a work environment that is diverse and inclusive. We proudly adhere to all anti-discrimination legislation. We do not tolerate any type of discrimination against or harassment of our employees, or any of our affiliates. If you are looking to join a team that values a diverse range of backgrounds, opinions, and skills, we would like to meet with you.

title: Training Program Manager
description:
Training Program ManagerLocation: Mountain View; CA (HYBRID)Duration: 5-6 Months
Overview:Training Program Manager, you manage the training and knowledge program for agents, by providing learner-centric training strategies. You will analyze trends and future launches to anticipate training needs and advocate the continual improvement of the agent training experience. Working with our cross-functional teams, you will create training project plans, review the design and development process, and coordinate with our vendors to ensure smooth delivery and implementation. You will report training progress and evaluate the training to understand its effectiveness. Additionally, you should have strong leadership, organizational, problem-solving, networking and communications skills.
Top 4 Daily Responsibilities:Consult with business partners and stakeholders to determine the most effective training strategy to support products and workflows.Analyze trends in quality results, policy launches, anticipate learning needs, and devise appropriate training interventions.Lead the development and implementation of curricular framework to drive business results.Drive training development to completion by managing timelines, overseeing the instructional design process, and coordinating the delivery of training
Mandatory Skills/Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Education, Instructional Design, related field or equivalent practical experience.Experience deploying training programs to 3rd party partners.Experience managing cross-functional projects with delivery in organizations.Training and knowledge management: Identifying training needs, developing and updating training and knowledge materials, delivering training, evaluating training effectivenessAdult learning and education: Knowledge of principles and methods for learning content design, instructions and guides to facilitate learning, and the measurement of learning effects, including the ability to apply training methods to help others learn subject matter knowledge.Managing meetings effectively: Ability to set meeting agendas, understand the audience, set action items, and drive meetings to the desired outcome. This includes following up on action items and communicating decisions that result from meetings.Consultative skills: Ability to understand stakeholder needs through dialogue before conducting analysis and making recommendations.Data analysis and synthesis: Ability to analyze information, draw conclusions, generate alternatives and solutions, and evaluate outcomes. This includes the ability to use data to add value to business planning and strategies.Program management: Knowledge of the process of managing several related projects, often with the intention of improving an organization's performance.
industry: Business Consulting and Services, Software Development

title: Utilities Mechanic - HVAC - JW
description: RED-Rochester is a multi-utility generation plant and district energy supplier to one of the world’s most comprehensive industrial parks: the Eastman Business Park. Supporting a 1,200-acre campus, RED-Rochester has the utilities, infrastructure, technical services, support services, space and complementary regional resources to benefit a wide range of industry verticals. We are seeking an HVAC Utilities Mechanic to support maintenance and improvement among tenant businesses of the Eastman Business Park microgrid.  Job DescriptionSummary: Responsible for replacement, maintenance and/or repairs of HVAC equipment in or around all RED-Rochester Operated facilities located within Eastman Business Park.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:► Maintain Clear and Consistent Communication relating to the current status, performance and needs of your assigned location with RED-Rochester team supervisor, maintenance planner and operations staff. Ensure all RED-Rochester customer communicated concerns are immediately communicated and appropriately responded to.► Assists Maintenance Planner to develop standard preventive maintenance routines to ensure maximum equipment uptime and lifespan is attained for all responsible systems.► Assists Maintenance Planner to develop corrective (repair) maintenance job plans as needed to ensure all equipment repairs are completed in a timely basis to maintain all system redundancies for optimum emergency performance.► Coordinates with Maintenance Planner, all shutdown planning (routine & emergency) for the execution of maintenance activities to include Customer end-user notifications.► Complete all planned maintenance routines for assigned locations, documenting all actions within the RED-Rochester work order management system (MAXIMO®).► Complete all assigned corrective maintenance actions, documenting all actions within the RED-Rochester work order management system (MAXIMO®).► Assist with any Plant Overhaul, Upgrade or Modernization Activities being completed within assigned locations.► Supervise any outside Contractor executing work within your assigned work location to ensure compliance with RED-Rochester safety policies and that the RED-Rochester standards for workmanship are maintained.► Work, as needed within the larger team structure for Red-Rochester major emergencies or catastrophic failures.► Assist in the development and implementation of Health, Safety, Environmental, Safety procedures as required for the execution of assigned work duties.► Complete appropriate record keeping for numerous governmental agencies is up-to-date and accurate (ie: DEC, EPA, etc).Required Equipment Competencies:► Building Environmental: HVAC systems: to include, air-handling units, package cooling units, computer room air conditioning units, fan-coils, unit heaters, warehouse style hanging heaters, exhaust fans, recirculating fans, associated equipment such as dampers, dampers, vents and valves.► Building Environmental: HVAC building control systems, both electronic and pneumatic – and all subcomponents such as Thermostats, control valves, actuators.► General site equipment, such as: Instrument air compressors, Air dryers, Steam & Electric boilers, Steam traps, condensate return systems, etc.Soft skills Competencies:  ► Excellent and Clear Communication skills.► Demonstrated ability to work independently or within a team environment.► Demonstrated Mechanical system aptitude and abilities.► Demonstrated ability to read and comprehend blueprint or Autocad® based system drawings.► Demonstrated conceptual and practical trouble shooting skills.► Ability to follow procedures, work instructions and safety/environmental regulations.► Ability to read and understand prints and drawings that pertain to all systems.Education and/or Experience:► High school diploma/GED.► Applicable Associates or Bachelor’s degree preferred, but not required.► Demonstrated ability (minimum 48 months), working on, servicing and repairing building Heating, Ventilation, & Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems. Qualifications or Licenses:► Must have an EPA Section 608 Universal Refrigeration License.► Must maintain required safety operator licenses, as needed for fork truck, man lift and scissor lift (Employer Provided as required).► Must maintain OSHA 10hr certification every 2 years.► Must maintain OSHA 30hr certification every 5 years.► Must obtain and maintain City of Rochester, Refrigeration R-4 license within 2 years. ► Must have an unencumbered valid NYS drivers’ license.Work Environment:► Industrial indoor and outdoor working environment; potential exposure to weather conditions common to Rochester New York; potential for work in confined spaces.Physical Demands:► Position requires core body strength due to strenuous effort, climbing, and crawling to accomplish equipment isolation and movement of material.► Lifting and carrying of a variety of equipment weighing up to 50 lbs is sometimes necessary along with moving large valves and piping weighing more than 50 lbs.► Potential to enter manholes underground (Confined spaces) and the Utilities tunnels.

title: Commercial Lines Account Manager - Workers' Compensation
description:

Commercial Lines Account Manager - Workers' Compensation

Are you looking for an engaging, rewarding role within the insurance industry?

If so, a leading agency is seeking a Commercial Lines Account Manager with Workers' Compensation experience. This position plays a pivotal role in delivering unparalleled service that leaves a lasting impression. title: Director, Global Compliance
description:
Position Summary:

Under minimal supervision, the Director Global Compliance manages all applicable regulatory (EMC, Safety and Materials compliance) approvals on all Professional Solutions products. In charge to define, develop and execute regulatory compliance business processes for Harman Professional solutions.

Provides pre-compliance and compliance testing support and coordination, responsible for maintaining and updating all compliance and compliance-related laboratories, and provides regular updates for all R&D related leadership and staff on current and anticipated compliance standards and regulations.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This position will lead and develop a regulatory and compliance team of approximately 10-15 people across the globe (US, Hungary, Denmark, China) for Professional products including Audio, Lighting and Video and Control products.

Job Responsibilities:

Business process owner for Professional solutions product regulatory compliance processes across the product lifecycle, from NPI through sustaining to product end of life stages. Scope of role – Brands: 8+ Harman Pro brands including AKG, Crown, JBL, BSS, Lexicon, Soundcraft, AMX, MartinScope of revenue – >$900MM annual revenue; successful product compliance is required to ship all Harman Pro product globally. Specific countries/regions including USA, North America, Central/South America, China, Australia, Japan, Korea, India, and the entire EU/UK region. Scope of technologies – The Global Compliance leader must support products using their understanding and knowledge of the regulatory compliance requirements of products using these technologies: Batteries (rechargable/non-rechargable); RF (WiFi, wireless microphone, NFC, Bluetooth); Large Switching power supplies up to 250V/50A; Professional LED lighting fixtures up to 40k lumen intensity; embedded analog/digital hardware; Video including HDMI, HDBaseT; Network connectivity including WiFi, ethernet 1G/10G; IoT products B2B and B2C. Scope of Impact: Lack of compliance will immediately halt sales revenue on affected products; Must have an understanding and ability to manage the Financial and legal penalties of non-compliance. Strategic and tactical role; Reports to VP global R&DManage annual budget of $10MM and 10 employees on 3 continents. Track strategic regulatory environment in Pro countries and markets; align team activity to achieve/maintain product compliance; report to Harman/Samsung on risks, mitigation, actions. Regulatory environment is changing rapidly with additional standards for sustainability, raw materials used, Life Safety, Cyber Security. Inform and educate design engineers on compliance environment and design requirements to ensure product designs comply with regulation. Manages external regulatory and government agencies,test labs and other compliance suppliers; contracts/scheduling/oversees quality of resultsSupport global sales internal and global distribution partners (external) with documentation needed to ship productsLiasion to internal and external Legal experts to obtain opinion and alignment on applicable standards specific to Harman products. Assuring product portfolio compliance for EMC, Safety and Materials compliance globally for all Harman Professional ProductsPlans and performs pre-compliance and compliance testing, including tests under the scope of laboratory accreditation. Identifies and documents product approval requirements for projects. Develops, revises, and/or reviews EMC laboratory test procedures. Participates in regulatory related committees and professional organizations.. 

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or related field. iNARTE certified EMC Engineer preferred. 10+ years of experience in testing and obtaining regulatory agency approvals of electronic hardware products for EMC, wireless, and electrical safety requirements. Understanding and experience with RF systems, embedded analog and digital circuitryHas a full understanding of industry practices. Able to work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data or situations requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Previous management experience in a technical environment. Exercises judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions for difficult assignments and of diverse scope. 

Preferred Qualifications & Desired Competencies:

Previous experience or exposure to product related to audio, lighting, video, IoT or other related hardware/software products and industries preferred. Ability to influence through effective verbal and written communication skillsAble to accept responsibility for personal development and actions. Sets aggressive goals and drives for results. Team player – having respect for colleagues; leading teams with clarity and accountability. Capacity to work in a global, cross-functional, matrix organizationAbility to balance workload and achieve key deliverablesAbility to pay close attention to detailsCollaborative approach to working within a team environmentEffectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, engineers and other technical employees, and outside agencies. Currently active or willingness to be active in the EN54 regulatory organization. 

Eligibility Requirements:

Willingness to travel 20%. Willingness to work in a Harman Pro Solutions office in Richardson, TX. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.
